Reviews.Title: “Great service and cleanliness!”
Reviews.Author: Amy R Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location to Rush street and Michigan Ave. we could walk everywhere! Hotel was very clean and service was friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Accommodating staff and perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Lauricita
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel experience with the best staff in Chicago. Nice rooms and excellent location. Restaurant is a little pricey and sometimes slow service. I will continue to stay at The Talbott Hotel every time I visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely nice stay”
Reviews.Author: 50Kimmy
Reviews.Content: I would totally recommend this hotel. Everyone was so friendly and attentive. I highly recomend staying here. A personal favorite is the fact that they have free wifi. My only complaint was my view which was dark and seemed to be just of a roof top and the building next door which seemed about less than 20 feet away. I was on the 8th floor. But I definitely wouldn't let that deter you. Everything else was so nice that it truly made up for it. Besides the beautifully elegant decor, I would say the friendliness, niceness and attentiveness of the staff is one of this hotel's main strong points. Thanks for a great stay and I can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “The Talbott hotel provides a warm and inviting experience with superb service.”
Reviews.Author: Henryparker1
Reviews.Content: My young son and I recently had an unplanned stay at the Talbott due to an expired passport issue en route to Jamaica. Suffice it to say the hotel provided a much needed respite from what was otherwise turning out to be a nightmare trip. The staff was friendly and accommodating as we worked through the passport issue with the local passport agency; going so far as locating needed documents left in our room and then immediately faxing them to the agency while we waited. The hotel is within walking distance of all the Michigan ave hot spots. The ambience and feel of the hotel was warm and inviting. The bed was very comfortable and the room was very updated and clean. We will definitely be back for a planned stay.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and comfy”
Reviews.Author: Patrick O Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Talbott 4 times now and return because of the good value, great location, friendly professional service and comfortable rooms. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Humble and authenic”
Reviews.Author: foodblonde
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Staff are attentive but not overbearing. Thank you Gene, Perry..etc.. Rooms spacious and clean. Close to everything! Amazing place to relax and /or celebrate ! Sadly, I wouldn't eat in their restaurant again. Understaffed ! Slow! Medicocre..!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed Elegance”
Reviews.Author: Ratio22
Reviews.Content: With an authentic dignity and excellent staff, The Talbott is a jewel. No experience could have been better than hearing Pinky Zukerman playing the Brahms violin concerto with the Chicago Symphony and returning "home" to this hotel. The suite felt like a private apartment. Very quiet. For our three day special occasion, it was a fine value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Chicago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marvfish
Reviews.Content: After a quick check in we were escorted to a comfortable well appointed room. This is the perfect Chicago hotel. Great location, reasonably priced by Chicago standards and the staff is very friendly. In the future, the Talbott will be my first choice of Chicago hotels

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Rocketfire
Reviews.Content: Except for the bartender, the people at the Talbott were very helpful and friendly. The hotel is in a great location for walking to shopping and restaurants. We had a suite and it was huge. The bathroom was the largest I have ever had, and great for getting ready in the morning. The bed was very comfortable. The TVs were slightly confusing. We never did get our IPOD to work. A couple complaints about the room - there was not a mini-refrigerator. Instead of putting in those over-priced mini-bars (does anyone really purchase stuff out of these things?), have refrigerators. The other issue was the annoying sound of the elevators could be heard in our room. It sounds like an airplane going over. These elevators were very old and slow, and most of the weekend, only one was working. We ate in the restaurant for breakfast since we have $30 credit each morning. If you don't have breakfast included with your room, I would go somewhere else. It was OK. The orange juice was watered down badly!

Reviews.Title: “What a nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: dinerone1
Reviews.Content: Great value for a nice, big room in a good neighborhood. Comfortable bed, clean, excellent staff. I had a hard time with the tv remote.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms and great location”
Reviews.Author: Alice-thecat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Talbot hotel for 3 nights. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We walked many places - restaurants - shops and museums. Our room was very large with free wi-fi and a flat screen TV. We found the king size bed very comfortable! There was access to a fitness center but we didn't try it. There are lots of good restaurants in the area and the shops of North Michigan Avenue are close-by. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot ask for more”
Reviews.Author: Snorlaxxl
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the Talbott in the last 12 months. As with the last time the quality and service at this establishment were excellent. We booked direct with the Hotel and secured a very attractive off peak rate for December. With my wife and two children we had a room with two queen beds, staying for three nights. Even with the four of us we did not feel cramped although the bathroom was not particularly spacious. The beds were very comfortable with quality linens and with three chairs in the room we had enough options for seating. The room had free internet that worked through the TV - another excellent service. One of the things that we like about the Talbott is that you can open the windows, ever so slightly, but enough to let in some fresh air. Staff were friendly - particularly Perry the doorman - and gave us excellent advice as far as places to go. The Concierge also provided us with some very good tips as far as nearby dining. The location is excellent being just off the golden mile and close to many good restaurants. We enjoyed our stay at the Talbott and have no hesitation in recommending it for other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: 2EastCoastTravellers
Reviews.Content: We flew into Chicago for a weekend getaway. The Talbott was lovely. Great location. Beautiful lobby. Friendly staff! Everyone from the doorman to the front desk staff was friendly and helpful. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel, perfect for a weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: RickinShelby
Reviews.Content: Trust the reviews. If you demand a big hotel with all of the amenities, go elsewhere. If you want a pleasant hotel in the heart of the action but still a bit off the beaten path, The Talbott is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Great Buy”
Reviews.Author: MelvinaSt.Louis
Reviews.Content: Went to Chicago for a relaxing weekend after the holidays. We had often walked by Talbott in previous visits, and decided to stay here due to that and the Tripadvisor reviews. First impressions: Very European in style, small reception area, cosy nooks with fireplaces, but most especially, extremely welcoming staff (shout out to Bellman Dewayne!). We booked an Executive king room. It was nice and large, with comfortable king bed, nice linens, large bath the separate huge shower and soaking tub. It was very clean. I would say the carpet looked a little rough and should probably be replaced soon, but again it seemed clean. The rate was $225 per night, plus a $15 credit per person for breakfast at the adjoining restaurant, which doesn't really cover breakfast, but puts a nice dent in it. Loved the fact they have rich bath sheets, not scrawny cheap bath towels. The room had two robes, but they were quite small and not soft, mine barely closed and I am not an overly big gal. The state of the art TV is a hoot, with great internet options, including hooking up to your own Netflix account. The wi-fi was a little slow and spotty, but it was free, so not a problem. Our room was right next to the elevator, and I was afraid it would be noisy, but it was nice and quiet, except for some street noises to be expected. The only problem we encountered was the maid waking us up on our last morning when we were sleeping in. We had the privacy knob/latch turned on our door, but I don't know if it was broken or she just didn't see it. I would hazard a guess we were not the only guests who experienced this. I suggest going back to the old fashioned door hangars so this doesn't happen. Overall it was a great stay. We appreciated feeling so welcomed each time we returned. The room was nice, and the price and location are ideal. We will be back, just please let us sleep in, we don't get to do that at home!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in downtown Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Erika7979
Reviews.Content: I lived in Chicago for 5 years and recently went back for a visit with my husband. We had the BEST stay at the Talbot, and I'm so excited to make this my new go-to hotel for future visits to Chicago. The staff was really accommodating and warm, the hotel is updated and beautiful. The location is amazing. The rooms are spacious and clean, and the room service was super speedy. This is a boutique hotel with character and class...like a mini Ritz at a much better value. I would definitely recommend this hotel and can't wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “charming, cozy Chicago hotel”
Reviews.Author: Calgirl3
Reviews.Content: During a 5- week road trip, my husband and I stayed in many hotels across the US - some less fancy and some more. We still rave about the Talbott. From the excellent service, including the concierge, to the very comfy beds to the spacious bathroom to the fabulous location in the "near north" -- everything was just about perfect. We have found our Chicago hotel and will be back there on our next visit to this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: Crafttrips
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose the Talbott for an overnight getaway - our first trip alone since having two small children. The hotel was beautifully decorated for Christmas, and the staff was so cordial and professional. The location was good for us, and our room was fantastic - we had a suite, and we're already talking about staying there again with our kids, as there would be ample space for all of us. The bathroom was large as well, and nice. Everything was clean, with the exception of a small amount of leftover food in the refrigerator which had apparently been overlooked. (Not a big deal to us, as we weren't planning on using the fridge anyway.) We appreciated help from the concierge downstairs, and breakfast was delicious. We will most likely choose this hotel on our next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great post-Christmas getaway”
Reviews.Author: Peter_mpls
Reviews.Content: My partner, Katie, and I spent two nights at the Talbott between Christmas and New Year's. We had a great experience - exceeding our expectations. The room was very large with a good sized bathroom. The staff was very helpful and welcoming. We will definitely go to the Talbott again when we go to Chicago. I think it would work out well if we had brought the kids. Given the room size and the available adjoining room, we would have managed comfortably.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scott F
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Great Bed, Great T.V. w/DVR. Although not on Michigan Ave, this hotel has a great deli/grocery store across the street from it. It is mid block in a more residential feeling area and easily accessible to the public transportation along State Street. Just buy a multi day pass, and you will be riding buses, subways and the L train for free all over the City. I was a little concerned when I booked because the price was so reasonable compared to the other nicer big chain hotels, but we were pleasantly surprised and I would definitely stay again. I definitelly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: cricket23chicago
Reviews.Content: I went with my daughter for our annual Christmas shopping, eating, sight seeing trip. We read on Tripadvisor about the Talbott and wanted to check it out. It is an older small boutique hotel but very warm and cozy. Beautifully decorated for the holidays. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We had wine and appetizers in the lovely bar at Bice and then had a wonderful breakfast in the restaurant. Its a beautiful restaurant and breakfast was delicious. We had a king suite which are very big with a wonderful bathroom. The bed was very comfortable. The only negatives about the room was we could hear the elevator in the bedroom, I had asked to be away from the elevator but was told all the suite rooms are close to elevators. Also the couch and chairs in the living room were frayed and uncomfortable which was too bad because it is a nice big room. The other issue I had was I self parked in a garage the hotel told me to use and was told self parking was $34 a night valet was $51. When I went to pay at the garage it was $51 because I checked out 30 minutes after the 24hr period. I feel the hotel really needs to inform guests of this when they give them the validation ticket at the front desk. I went back to the hotel to tell them of the problem and was told to call the parking the garage because they charged me the $51 not the hotel. I am contacting the garage but I dont think they will credit me. I would go back again but other people need to know the parking issues.

Reviews.Title: “Location, amenity and service all great”
Reviews.Author: Spatulaman
Reviews.Content: I and my wife stayed this hotel one night in early Dec '11. The hotel is located in northern part of the downtown where the bustle of main street starts to settle. It's yet convenient enough to get to most of the tourist places in downtown on foot. The car parking was a public parking but was only around the corner, one minute walk from the building which cost around $35 dollars a night. I assumed it was average there. All the hotel people were very friendly. The room on the 14th floor we stayed was not very large but was nice and clean. The room had the Mac mini with wireless control which was nice to find things to do around on the bed. Overall it was a very pleasant stay and would like to return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Sue S
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I stayed at the Talbott while visiting Chicago for the first time, and just loved it. The staff was incredible, warm and welcoming. We splurged on a suite and were blown away! It was huge, with lovely furnishings and premium linens. The location is great for strolling and shopping Michigan Ave. and close to an "El" station for venturing further out. There are lots of good restaurants within walking distance. It really was a perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: tinyjudge
Reviews.Content: We went up to Chicago for our yearly December shopping weekend and stayed at The Talbott. The room was wonderful! The TV and other electronic extras had my husband in heaven. We loved the lobby with its beautiful wood, fireplaces and gorgeous Christmas decorations. The bar was so cozy. It was an extension of the lobby decor and feel. The service was wonderful---top shelf! The location is perfect for Michigan Ave. shopping and walking distance to so many restaurants and pubs.... If you like boutique hotels, this is perfect. Try it! You'll love it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: C R
Reviews.Content: The Talbott Hotel was recommended to me by a friend so when my adult daughter and 2 of her friends were planning a visit to see an exhibit in Chicago I decided to book them in to The Talbott. What a wonderful choice it was. After looking at their website, my initial contact was with a young man in their central reservations office. Though very nice and polite he was not informed enough to help with my queries so I asked that I be put through to the hotel, itself. I then spoke to Robert Byars in the on sight reservation area and he was amazing. Cordial, helpful, informative and offered and was willing to answer all of my queries and accommodate all of my unusual requests. For various reasons we ended up speaking often that week and I grew so fond of him on the phone that my next trip to Chicago - even just a day trip - I intend to stop by and meet him in person. He personifies customer service in an industry that demands it. My daughter took photos of the lobby & the room for me and sent me information each day she was staying. The lobby is exactly what a visitor to Chicago in the winter would hope to find. Warm wood walls, brass lighting and a fireplace burning...and tastefully decorated for the holidays. Their guest room was wonderful. There were 3 women staying together and the room was huge with 2 double beds, seating, and a large bath that could accommodate all of them getting ready at once. It was also tastefully decorated to be warm and inviting. The rate and all it included as excellent value for the money and the location is ideal. All in all I would recommend this hotel to any and all visiting Chicago and be sure to ask for Robert â€“ tell him the Mrs. Spaghetti said to say â€œhelloâ€�.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a girlfriend's weekend away”
Reviews.Author: sadiecharlotte
Reviews.Content: Located on a quiet street near Michigan Ave, you are a few blocks away from Michigan Ave shopping as well as great shops like Barneys on Oak Street. The lobby is small, but very quaint with a fire place. The staff goes out of their way to make sure your stay is excellent. Our room with 2 double bed was sizable for all of our shopping finds. The A Keurig coffee maker is a great touch for enjoying a cup of coffee in the morning before you leave. The towels in the bathroom are big and fluffy. Italian Restaurant Bice is attached to the hotel and you can enjoy a "shopped till you dropped" cocktail there before heading out to any of the great restaurants that are in walking distance. All of this for a rate that was reasonable for the experience. We are making this an annual trip!

Reviews.Title: “Designed by a frequent traveler?!”
Reviews.Author: mjbphx
Reviews.Content: Everything was well thought out and nicely appointed. The room could be made dark, and was very quiet. The bed, pillows, towels and robes felt luxurious. The shower was set high...good for tall folks. Specific programs and channels could be found easily on the flat screen TV. A Keurig coffee maker made making coffee and tea easy. Free internet access. At $190/night for Gold Coast Chicago, it was a very decent value. Only change I would request--trade out the mini-bar for a mini refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Small, quiet, clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ThatGuyPatrick
Reviews.Content: This is a nice small hotel located blocks from Magnificent Mile. My room was spacious and very clean. The Apple TV with streaming Netflix was great although there was a technical issue with the streaming during my stay. The maintenance staff could not fix it but the Front Desk Manager actually came up personally and resolved it; that was really impressive. The restaurant was good but a better (and more affordable) breakfast option is around the corner at Tempo Cafe. I will definitely return to the Talbott on my next Chicago visit.

Reviews.Title: “Would most highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Svenskachic
Reviews.Content: Among the hotels I have stayed at in Chicago this one surpasses them all. Upon arriving we were warmly greeted by the doorman and the desk staff were all welcoming and helpful. Our room was very clean, spacious and beautifully appointed. The beds were so comfortable and had luxurious sheets and down pillows. We had a comfortable seating area and an ample size desk with Internet access connected to the tv. The bathroom was large, clean and had a heated marble floor. All this and two blocks to the Miracle Mile! Didn't have an opportunity try the restaurant/bar but from the size of the crowd, it too was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Can do no wrong”
Reviews.Author: GlobalGal-Ireland
Reviews.Content: From the very second I pulled up at the front door of this charming boutique hotel I was welcomed with a genuine warmth from Charles the Doorman. From there on the experience with all members of staff from the lovely lady doing the Night Audit shift to the staff in the restaurant Bice, has been nothing short of exceptionally positive. There is nothing scripted about these people, they offer such a pleasant experience that I'm sorry to be leaving today, and will look forward to a return visit. Facilities are lovely - the room I was allocated is very spacious, and the furniture in the room is extremely comfortable, and of course the Molton Brown bathroom products are also very pleasant. While the hotel doesn't have its own fitness area they do off complimentary access to a truly wonderful centre called Equinox which is just around the corner in the basement of Bloomingdales...really worth the visit. This hotel gets it right, thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury boutique hotel in great Chicago location”
Reviews.Author: newhiker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Talbott Hotel on a visit to our son and daughter-in-law. Staff was friendly and helpful, room was roomy and very fresh. There was a desk if we needed it, but the room was very comfortable with easy chairs as well. Bathroom was beautiful. Everything was newly upgraded. We were able to walk to many Chicago attractions from this centrally located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious gem and great value in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Cathy W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Talbott Hotel the weekend of October 7-9: my husband and I, with my father, for a weekend of sightseeing. Like New York City, hotels in Chicago are expensive, but this one is an excellent value. We booked a King suite and a deluxe King, so we would have some comfortable space for "downtime." When we were shown to our rooms, we were absolutely amazed at how big they were, and how beautiful. The suite had a large bedroom, large bathroom (with tub, shower and 2 heights of sink counters--the low one had a chair to do makeup, or would be great for kids), and hallway and a beautiful living room with 2 front windows, beautiful desk, small bar, and living area with huge flatscreen TV. It was bigger than most one-bedroom apartments! My father's deluxe King was also extremely large with a living area in his bedroom and large bath as well. We felt like we were in the lap of luxury! And because I booked online at their website breakfast was included ($15.00 value apiece) for each day in the wonderful Bice Restaurant downstairs, which has a beautiful bar and delightful outdoor dining area. Very popular place. Although certainly a "splurge" weekend, for the same prices, we have more often than not gotten much, much less for rooms billed as "suites" and "deluxe." Additionally, everyone who worked in the hotel and restaurant provided the most attentive service. Check-in and out was a breeze. They also have a top-notch Concierge service. All 3 people we dealt with handled everything from transportion from the airport, to helping us with sightseeing, to restaurant reservations. They were pros and we would have been lost without them. The location is north of the Loop, about 3 blocks off Michigan Avenue, not far from the John Hancock Observatory and the American Girl place. We walked everywhere, even my dad, it is totally flat. We were just close enough to the "Miracle Mile" and to many of the sights, or to Lincoln Park to the north, where we toured the fascinating Chicago History Museum. Yet we were just far enough away to be quiet and relaxed. It is right next to another small park and a residential areas which are quite nice. There are plenty of great restaurants nearby, too. It's a great base for touring Chicago and you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: pucca75
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. My husband and I were going down to Chicago for the long weekend and had no idea where to stay/what to do. This was our first trip to the Windy City, and it will not be our last! The staff at the Talbott were so nice! The doorman in particular was a great man who always greeted us, opened doors for us, and even gave us suggestions on what to do and where to go. Definitely will stay here again the next time we are in town! Plus, the hotel is right where you want to be...very close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “New favorite Chicago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: commishonwheels
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with a friend Nov. 12 for one night. Best part is that we paid $189/night, which was a deal. I booked a king, as that was all there was, but called in the morning, and by the time we got there at about 1:00, they had a cancellation and gave us a free upgrade to 2 queen beds. They remembered my call, and me, and were so nice. The front desk, bellman and doorman were all just so kind. The room was spacious, luxurious, with great bath products (Moulton Brown), wonderful shower,huge towels softer than any others I've used in a hotel, and the beds were great. Keurig coffee maker. The thermostat does not go down lower than 65 degrees, and that is a little hot for me for sleeping, but for most that will not be an issue. It is superbly located for Rush Street fun. Quiet, perfect. We could not have done better in downtown Chicago. It is a pretty good walk from the train station, but we pulled our suitcases and walked in about 30 minutes with no problem. If it were snowing, we would have taken a cab. We ate at Hugo's Frog 2 blocks away, had drinks at Tavern on Rush, and I will stay there again, absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, excellent staff, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: indigofire
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a long weekend in Chicago - looking for a fun but relaxing get away without our children. The Talbott was a fantastic choice (thank you previous TA posters). The location is perfect - just off State Street a few blocks north of Chicago. The hotel is on a quiet side street. Our room was on the 13th floor and for a large city, it was very quiet. Only a few blocks from Water Tower Place and Michigan Ave for shopping. Lots of restaurants and bars close by - Tempo Cafe for breakfast was excellent, Pizanos Pizza just around the corner has great deep dish with lots of cheese, a Starbucks on one corner and a local "Goddess" fantastic bakery/coffee/deli on the other. Also a little market, Potash, around the corner. Loved it all! The staff was friendly and helpful. We kind of kept to ourselves and didn't request much, but anytime we did ask for something our expectations were more than met. The room was very nice - comfortable bed, free wi-fi, big flat screen tv, room darkening shades, large bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BDBELL80138
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel in a great location. Would definitely Tay here

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel at Its Best!”
Reviews.Author: Louis14221
Reviews.Content: A new favorite while in Chicago is the Talbott Hotel. The moment you speak to a member of their staff, a worry-free holiday begins. Parking is is less than a block away...$32! The Bellman and the Concierge offer wonderful tips pertaining to your visit to Chicago. And the hotel is home to the wonderful restaurant, BICE! The hotel ambiance is quiet elegance. It is beautiful!!!! You will never be disappointed for staying on this quiet street so close to Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Who says you can't go back ?"”
Reviews.Author: Jacq047
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago for the second time on a "ladies trip". Just like our first trip to The Talbott we were greeted like old friends. Arrived on Halloween to baskets of candy in the lobby ! They zip you through check in and you're good to go !! Dwayne walked us through the new Apple Tv system that does just about anything. You can DVR a show or charge a movie to your Netflix account !! Asked and received suggestions about restaurants,shopping and architectural tours. The staff, including the general manager, Tray Strand, have lived there quite a while and give you the insider's view. Clean ? Way clean, especially with the yummy Molton Brown bath products. Looking forward to ur next trip there.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Foxtripper
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my second "girl's trip" to Chicago in as many years and stayed at the Talbott again. The hotel is top notch!! The staff that was there last year recognized us and we were greeted like old friends. We noticed some positive changes: new restaurant and great Apple TV with a wireless keyboard and mouse that allowed us to communicate with our families without having to go to the business center. The 4 of us shared 2 rooms according to our "temperature" preferences and we could easily adjust the temp in our respective rooms. We were treated to fruit platters. The staff was friendly and helpful and the concierge staff was particularly helpful with recommendations and reservations as well as coupons for our shopping. Troy, the general manager, greeted us personally and was very gracious and attentive. Love this hotel!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD”
Reviews.Author: Maxandsari2
Reviews.Content: it was really good. the room were nice and big. it had great serive! people were very nice. i had a very nice stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Temporary Home near Water Tower Place”
Reviews.Author: wlamb123
Reviews.Content: There are hotel stays that leave an impression and, without a doubt, the Talbott leaves it's guests with an impression and more. Comfortable stylish beds. A pleasing and friendly staff. Great location. The rates may seem high, but you're worth it. The Hancock Building is a block away as is Water Tower Place, the bustling Michigan Avenue and the Museum of Contemporary Art. I missed having a mini-bar and refrigerator, yet it was worth every penny I spent.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience”
Reviews.Author: tom d
Reviews.Content: Talbott simply has the BEST staff. The price is very good for Chicago and the best service. We booked the American Girl Doll Experience and were to arrive Saturday. We got in at 8:35 pm after a long drive and before we even gave them our names, the Chief Concierge Gene came up and greeted my kids by name. They are six and nine and this astounded them. He also greeted my daughter's American Girl Doll by name. He then had special room card keys for each with their name embossed on them. They also had special stationery and personalized menus in the room for my kids with their names on them. What an amazing touch. Even though my son is nine they included him and made him feel a part of the experiecne. There were pictures of them in the lobby and then on a carriage ride that took us around downtown. We could have had it take us to the American Girl Store but we had already been so we toured Chicago instead. We stayed for 5 days and the kids loved it. Chicago has great museums and experiences for the kids with some of the best restaurants anywhere. The Talbott is clean and comfortable. It is near Michigan Ave and all the shopping including the American Girl Store. I travel a lot for business and have stayed in many "luxury" hotels. No one has staff and service to compare to the Talbott.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Doidgemorris
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Chicago. We stayed at the Talbot for three days and were very impressed. The staff was helpful and polite. Our room was huge, beds comfortable and clean. The HVAC, coffee maker worked efficiently. Within walking distance to many excellent food emporiums and good dining room in hotel as well. Close to excellent shopping. Thank you Talbott and Chicago for introducing us to your wonderful City.

Reviews.Title: “great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: parkpie
Reviews.Content: just returned from a three night visit in chicago. this was my first experience at the talbott and i have to say it certainly has an old world charm. the large room with two queen beds had been renovated but it was darkly decorated and looked disappointingly dated. the bathroom is much smaller and really ill equipped to handle three or four people. the elevator was a nemesis throughout the night as well because the room was right next to it. however, the staff was amazingly friendly and attentive and well equipped to handle our questions, concerns and needs for locating restaurants and stores. the location is fabulous. all in all the stay at the talbott was better than good bordering on the very but i would probably try another 4 star hotel the next time.

Reviews.Title: “The towels weren't up to snuff (ing).”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey_Sarver
Reviews.Content: The Talbott Hotel on Delaware Place is wonderfully located in the Old Town-Gold Coast-Michigan Mile area of wonderful Chicago. I walked everywhere to shop and eat, left my car parked in a garage next to the Four Seasons. Overnight was $40, cash only! Very good garage, friendly help and I liked that it was safely stowed by elevator upstairs and not just sitting in a self-pay parking lot. The best thing about The Talbott Hotel is the staff. Everyone I encountered was genuinely friendly and helpful and seemed to like their jobs. The Bice restaurant has a very nice bar off the lobby. Great bartenders, nice ambience. It is one of the great attractions of the hotel. Some customers were eating Italian food in the bar and it looked excellent and they were chowing down with gusto. The appearance of the hotel is very elegant on the outside, slightly more casual inside. Frankly it needs an overhaul. The color scheme of the rooms is drab and slightly depressing, all browns and creams. For hotel furniture it is excellent though. But I'd lose the chintzy swags over the beds. There was something a little disturbing about them visually. The bed was fantastic. A huge king size that could hold 4 people comfortably shoulder-to-shoulder. Great pillows. The only thing that seemed bad form to me were the towels. They were not top quality (fluffy and soft) but slightly course and, worse, though clean, smelled sweaty. Bad show Talbott. Fix the towel problem and you've got 5 stars from this client. I will stay there again in spite of the towels. The sheets were just fine, smelled clean and were soft.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: AndreamacLouisville
Reviews.Content: The Talbot hotel is one of many good hotels in Chicago, but what makes it different is the service. The location was great for shopping and the bed was super.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: BW_MS
Reviews.Content: Hotels don't have to be gigantic to provide a great stay. Our room was not huge by square footage but clean, comfortable and had numerous amenities. The hotel is close to many attractions and all the shopping one can hope for. Many excellent restaurants within a short walk or ride. The staff is very helpful and to sum it up my wife and I agree we would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago and the Talbott”
Reviews.Author: Sydxo
Reviews.Content: I took my granddaughter to Chicago to see the American Girl Store there and stayed at the Talbott Hotel which is just around the corner from the Store. Staff were sooo nice and welcoming. They have an American Girl package although we chose to do our own. The rooms are renovated and spacious, very nicely done. On our first day our TV didn't work and they had difficulty fixing it so they gave us a beautiful suite which we enjoyed. Service was great. The concierge was very helpful and gave us a discount at a restaurant we want to go to to get Chicago Deep Dish Pizza. She also gave us many directions including which buses to take to get there. We wholly recommend this hotel for business or family trips. We have stayed in other renovated hotels that have not done so well as the Talbott. It is really beautiful, cozy and warm.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the positive reviews!”
Reviews.Author: PIckyGirlyGuest
Reviews.Content: Definitely a little gem tucked away in a big city. The staff is amazingly courteous, attentive, and very personable with the guests. Although I can't remember all the names, Perry, DeWayne and Robert stood out the most. Will definitely return because of the highly trained and memorable staff! The hotel itself is very clean, cozy and warm with the added touches of luxurious linens, nightly turn downs with chocolates. The rooms are unusually large, spacious and very comfortable. When booking a hotel in Chicago, I almost couldn't believe the number of positive reviews The Talbott received. Believe them! Most definitely a memorable hotel that made for a great weekend with friends.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: wdmlsm
Reviews.Content: Our room was quite nice and well equiped with amenities. The staff in the hotel were super nice and the concierge was great! The location of the hotel was about 2 blocks off Michigan Ave. so it was a little less congested there and quieter. We walked every where; the city was fantastic and all the venues from museums, restaurants, tours were the best! We would definately go to Chicago again and stay at the Talbott.

Reviews.Title: “Good Things Come In Small Packages”
Reviews.Author: Bill R
Reviews.Content: The Talbott Hotel came highly recommended by a friend who occasionally travels to Chicago. After a long drive to the city, we were met at the curb by Landon, who happily welcomed us as if we were returning guests, though this was our first stay. The intimate lobby with itâ€™s two historic fireplaces, dark wood, traditional furnishings and clubby atmosphere is a lovely moment of homey tranquility and sets the stage for your stay. Check-in was quick and efficient and Landon showed us to our room and explained the Apple TV (thanks loads, Talbott, DH loved it and now Iâ€™m probably going to have to get one at home!) We had a corner suite, which was enormous, with a separate living room area and large bathroom. Speaking of the bathroom, I had a great soak in the huge tub and appreciated the separate shower. Whose idea was it to put the double bathroom basins in separate counters? â€“ Brilliant! Kathy, the concierge, was more than helpful in finding a great local eatery. All of the Talbottâ€™s concierges are members of Les Clefs dâ€™Or, by the way, so you are in good hands with any of their service and recommendations. We loved the Frette linens, the quiet inside the room and we felt as safe and secure as if we were in our own home. And the location in the midst of the Gold Coast puts shopping, dining, and sightseeing all within easy reach. As a hotel general manager, I am very particular about accommodations and the Talbott most certainly lives up to itâ€™s AAA Four Star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Enjoys_Relaxing
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Talbott for 3 nights. Having booked the hotel through slh.com, I was expecting my club member information being transferred to the hotel upon arrival. However, that wasn't the case. I did however receive late check out upon request. However, from the minute I pulled up to the front door, I was greeted with extreme courtesy, and I even got a grand tour of the hotel room (with their recently installed Apple TV - even though plenty of kinks they still need to work out). The location of the hotel is great, just a couple blocks West of Michigan Avenue, and extremely safe to walk around. There are plenty of restaurants around and the shopping (the expensive stuff) is just around the corner. The price of the room is pretty equivalent to others in town (except for the higher end properties), and parking of course costs an arm and a leg (although they are slightly cheaper alternatives with other parking lots/structures). The housekeeping staff is the most friendly bunch I have encountered (particularly in a major metropolitan city). Upon check out, the front staff was motivated to correct any problems with the billing. Overall, a much friendlier and interactive environment than the other bigger hotel chains that I have stayed in Chicago before. BTW, the room size is also bigger than the usual for Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value. Very nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: eof025
Reviews.Content: Great location off of N.Michigan Ave. Room was nicely appointed and very clean. Breakfast at Bice outside was very nice and quite reasonable with the breakfast vouchers.

Reviews.Title: “I've found my new Chicago "Home" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jonniechoochoo
Reviews.Content: Beautiful boutique hotel, very nice well appointed rooms, larger than average. The location is perfect....on a quiet side street, yet only a short walk to N. Michigan Ave. The staff was very pleasant, they made you feel at home. There is a very nice restaurant adjacent where we had breakfast at a sidewalk table. I've stayed in Chicago dozens of times at a dozen hotels, but this is where I'll be staying next time. We're done with the crowded, noisy, chain hotels and their mediocre rooms and inflated prices.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location, nice rooms, tiny meeting facilities, horrible catering”
Reviews.Author: TeamWplusT
Reviews.Content: Rating for individual stay- EXCELLENT Rating for business meeting - LESS THAN AVERAGE After hosting a large, multi-day meeting, I can say that: 1) Attendees loved the large sleeping rooms and the location. Great places to eat and shop right around the corner. If you are going on a girls trip or a romantic getaway, this is a GREAT hotel. Beds are comfortable, linens are luxurious. Very much a boutique, tiny lobby, small elevators, tiny bar and a business center that is really just a computer and a printer. It's less of a work hotel and more about play. 2) Meeting rooms are small and there are only three - one that is a small boardroom, one that is a windowless rectangle, one that is a skinny rectangle with windows. If you have a small group, it's perfect, but there is no room to grow if your meeting does. Unfortunately, the stats on their website regarding meeting rooms capacity do not include the space needed for audio/visual, catering set up, etc. so plan for less than what is shown. Restrooms for meeting attendeesare very small so plan for longer breaks . 3) The catering is horrible. For the price, you expect there to be enough food in the buffets, more variety in the snacks, and of course for it to taste halfway decent. It simply did not meet expectations. You have to stay on top of what you ordered because they seem to have no quality-control or attention to detail, no one to say "they ordered the nuts but there are no nuts here." If you don't catch it, they don't, but of course you have already guaranteed payment. This was true of all kinds of things (no coffee creamer, no spoons, etc.) In their defense, the help is quick to get whatever item you mention, but you have to bring it to their attention. Be warned - the "fresh-baked cookies" that come standard with most catering meals translates into a plate of cookies that look and taste suspiciously like Chips-A-Hoy with powdered sugar sprinkled across them.

Reviews.Title: “Service and Location is perfect”
Reviews.Author: jerkyking
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Talbott Hotel and couldn't be happier. The service and the location is great. It's close to many restaurants, shopping, and services. The rooms are very adequate in size especially if you have a suite. The outdoor dining during the warmer months is fantastic (almost like your in Paris). It really is a very enjoyable and nice experience. I would highly recommend it. The bellman Duane and his staff cannot due enough for you. They welcome you and make you feel at home. Kudos to management for taking care of its customers.

Reviews.Title: “Olde worlde charme”
Reviews.Author: Londonkraut
Reviews.Content: I can see that this place appeals to Europeans as well as to Americans in search of old world comfort, and the Talbott delivers on all fronts: professional staff, very clean rooms, nice linen and towels and some of my favourite bathroom compliments. The room we had was back facing with no views but very quiet, the bed was ultra comfortable, and the only spoiling factor was the lack of daylight in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kirsten34
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Talbott Hotel in Chicago over Labour Day weekend. It is a beautiful, clean, quiet hotel. The room we had (two queen beds) was very big. There was a large desk, two extra chairs and room to spare. We splurged on the American Girl package for our girls. They had beds for their dolls waiting for them when we arrived, as well as a welcome letter. They were very excited. They also had delicious cupcakes delivered to them (with two extra for mom and dad - very nice) with milk. The hotel is very close to the shopping area and the Hancock building. The walk to Navy Pier was less than half an hour walking with children. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The restaurant is not inexpensive, but you get what you pay for. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Twogreynomads
Reviews.Content: A convenient location with updated rooms. Expansive inside restaurant with quaint bar. Also patio seating. Smaller but charming rooms. Very hospitable. Appreciate rooms with two robes, in room coffee, room darkening curtains and larger, thicker towels. Latest technology in room. Valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: threekidsplustwo
Reviews.Content: We stopped in Chicago for the night on our drive down to Tennessee and stayed at the Talbot. I was traveling alone with my children and this hotel was perfect. It was right in the middle of the city and in a very safe and nice location. We were able to park in a ramp adjacent to the hotel. The hotel is an older boutique hotel that is beautifully kept and updated. Our room was large, the beds were dreamy and the bathrooms terrific. The bath products - Molton Brown. All of the staff were very kind and accommodating. Our room included breakfast which was delicious and served outside. We have visited Chicago and stayed at many places, we will definitely return to the Talbot on our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Oldie with Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: shelleyjr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here August 22-24, 2011. We booked ahead on Orbitz to get a good rate. This hotel is very lovely, it is tastefully decorated. Down comforter on the bed, turn down service at night with chocolates! Our room had one king size bed for the 2 of us, a desk with 2 chairs and a viewing chair next to the bed to watch TV. Plus a credenza with a fridge inside. The bathroom had a granite counter-top, a dryer and a wonderful magnifying mirror. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They really make you feel welcomed. The location is excellent too, the Chicago Red line is on State just 3 blocks south of the hotel. (Get off the Red line at Chicago/State.) There is a Starbucks across the street and behind that a small grocery store called Potash (get CTA passes there). We never ate at the hotel, but did get drinks across the street at Feast restaurant and bar, the prices were good and so were the drinks. The service is a tad slow there. Michigan avenue is very close just a short walk east. The John Hancock/Cheesecake Factory is less than 1/2 mile walk from the hotel. We loved everything about this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: robinreps
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel that got the renovation right. Timeless elegance meets high tech. I knew I loved it when I saw the Mac mini connected to the flat screen tv. The room was roomy with a high ceiling, comfy king aize bed with a beautiful canopy effect which rippled in the air flow and displaced the draft from the air conditioning, sumptuous fabrics, nice desk with free wireless Internet, huge bathroom with marble and granite and double sinks. I asked for a view and had two tall windows overlooking the street. One opened. Bice, the restaurant, has a gorgeous outdoor terrace. The surprised me with 15.00 breakfast vouchers for each of my 3 days there and I enjoyed a lovely meal on the terrace each morning. I had dinner on the terrace and the risotto was fabulous. Great service from the moment you walk in the door till you leave. I was sad to go and cannot wait to come back. Great value, too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ibetrippin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Talbott last week for a business meeting. The hotel is very elegant and charming. It's an old structure, so I was expecting the rooms to be small. The opposite was true. Very generously sized rooms with a comfortable king bed, sitting area, and large bathroom. Each room also has a Mac Mini connected to the flat screen TV so you can surf the Web. I did not eat in the restaurant, but it looked quite nice, and the bar area is elegant. This is a gem of a hotel, and I would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Another Splendid Evening At The Talbott!”
Reviews.Author: JoMich
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth year staying at the Talbott, and again, we were so grateful for the understated elegance and superb service. The staff is incredibly accommodating--even gave us the same room when I asked. We were delighted and surprised when the management sent a box of chocolate truffles to the room because I had mentioned that my husband and I always celebrate our summer birthdays at the Talbott. It is thoughtful touches like this one that will always keep us returning to our favorite Chicago hotel. Beautifully appointed, incredibly clean and comfortable, the Talbott truly is a cut above the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Well Located with Amazing Service & Great American Girl Pkg!”
Reviews.Author: polo-p
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had the lovliest stay here for her first visit to both Chicago and the American Girl (AG) Store after years of collecting the dolls. I highly recommend Talbott's AG Package if you have interested daughters! They definitely give your child the royal treatment complete with special room service menu that's an incredible value in itself not to mention the scrumptious breakfasts included at Bice with outdoor dining next door, and the 30-minute horse-drawn carriage ride in the Magnificent Mile vicinity to the AG Store is wonderful. Beyond the AG bit and food, the staff are really personable and accomodating and the rooms spacious and equipped with cool coffee machines and free wi-fi access. And you can't beat the location in charming area right off Michigan Avenue (and I used to live in Chicago for almost 10 years so I know what I''m talking about here). The housekeeping keeps your room amazingly tidy (2-3X per day) and is very generous in replenishing towels and toiletteries. Only wish the rooms got more sunlight. Other than that, overall just splendid!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic on everything!!!”
Reviews.Author: zainygirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, spent 3 nights at The Talbott Hotel in June 2011 and It's the most wonderful hotel I've ever been in. You can't get a better location. Walking distance to shopping, restaurants, sites etc. It really is perfect! I've never written a review about anything, but I just have to for this hotel. The staff were friendly, very helpful and knowledgable. It was perfect in everyway! The huge 1 bedroom suite was beautifully decorated and very clean and fresh. I will be coming back without a doubt!!

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Francofile37
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two friends stayed at the Talbott Hotel in Chicago to celebrate a special birthday!! None of us had been to Chicago before so we really didn't have a clue what part of the city would be best to stay in etc. Luckily someone from my office recommended this one to us and we are so glad. The hotel is in the nicest part of town. It is cozy, quaint and charming. The staff is exceptional. The concierge Jean Murray was right-on, when it came to sending us to restaurants and to a really cool blues club. Everything about our stay was perfect and we would go back to this hotel again when we re-visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: deputey
Reviews.Content: I had a few criteria before going, free internet, good location to the sights, and comfortable clean bed & bathroom. This hotel certainly met all our criteria & more, and the king parlor room was huge by hotel standards, the TV was actually to far from the bed to watch ;o) Breakfast each morning in the onsite restaurant Bice was amazing, very well prepared. The staff was also extremely helpful & polite. Out ONLY complaint was parking was a short walk offsite and the validated parking through the hotel was only $2/night leaving us a $98 parking fee for 3 nights. Although that seemed fairly common with most of the hotels I researched before going. If your looking for a classy but down to earth hotel, I highly recommend the Talbott.

Reviews.Title: “Stellar stay”
Reviews.Author: martyb-tripster
Reviews.Content: Our 3-night stay at the Talbott confirmed all the previous TripAdvisor raves about this boutique hotel a block off Michigan Avenue in the shadow of the Hancock tower. Other hotels may have fancier, more updated rooms, but it is hard to imagine finding a friendlier, more attentive staff. Our booking included a $15/person voucher for breakfast which we took on the charming sidewalk seating (indoor seating is also available). Well worth it, though my lovely companion, a coffee officianado, groused a bit about the house brew. We also took advantage of the complimentary use of the Equinox gym a block away in the Bloomingdale building. Some excellent, reasonably priced restaurants can be found a few blocks north of the Talbott on Rush Street. And there is no extra charge for the WiFi in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: David D
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay at the Talbott. It was terrific. The location is superb, a bit outside the bigger touristy locations, but still within easy walking distance of restaurants, shopping and all the sites we wanted to visit. We originally booked for two people, but a friend decided to join us. The hotel swapped our original room for a double queen room - at no extra charge! The staff were friendly, helpful and ready to do anything to make the stay a good one. Those loaner umbrella's in the lobby came in handy to the afternoon showers that hit every day. The room itself was quite large - with a good sized bathroom. The beds were good and the linens quite comfortable. The view wasn't great - we looked out at a wall - but we spent so little time in the room that it really didn't make much of a difference - and no complaints because we got that double queen room we really needed. I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a comfortable stay. Yes the price is more than you'd pay for a "basic" hotel... but totally worth it from my point of view.

Reviews.Title: “Business was a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: bcfrederick
Reviews.Content: The Talbott Hotel is the best hotel in downtown Chicago. I have stayed at and recommended this hotel to hundreds of people who have all enjoyed it as much as I have. The service is stellar, the staff is genuine and the location is just around the corner from everything. It is great for business or a quite weekend with your wife.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Peonies_Tulips
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our wedding night at the Talbott (& the next night), and we thought it was great! It is such a cute hotel in the Gold Coast- my favorite part of the city. We were able to walk to some of the best Chicago restaurants. They even upgraded our room because it was our wedding night :) The room was very cozy & elegant. We want to come back each year that we are in town for our anniversary and stay at the Talbott!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: jrj48
Reviews.Content: Wonderful small hotel just off Mich. Ave. Plus is day pass to the fitness club. Nice small bar.

Reviews.Title: “100% positive experience.”
Reviews.Author: Peonychic
Reviews.Content: Thank god for this hotel. After a sudden change of plans, I had to book Talbott Hotel on the fly. I'm so glad I did. I received an amazing rate and warm reception. The room was spacious, well appointed, impeccably clean and comfortable. Great location as well. I'm a tough critic and can't say enough about this place. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The Talbott Hotel is the BEST In CHICAGO!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisMadden
Reviews.Content: What an incredible experience. My husband and I stay at The Talbott Hotel every six months for a week each time. This is the 5th year we have done this and we just got home this week. I have to say I absolutely LOVE the staff! Our luggage mysteriously disappeared from our airline and we were without it for two days. Perry, the Bellman called every few hours one day to check on it for us, while we were working. Gene, the Concierge helped me find a pharmacy open at night and helped me make arrangements to get my prescriptions transferred. Andrew and Dwayne, both Bellman are top notch folks and took time with Taxi drivers to give directions and make sure they knew where we were headed. Sammy the car guy actually drives a Taxi himself and helped me get to the airport! Incredible group of folks that I truly appreciate. The front desk staff were invaluable in helping us this trip. Our room was fabulous! The addition of the Keurig coffee makers to the rooms is wonderful! The housekeeping staff did a phenomenal job of keeping our room neat and orderly and very very clean, and even supplied me with extra coffee pods for my entire stay! My only request is that the Talbott provide a table and chairs outside that guests could sit at late late at night or very early morning. Instead I had to go across the street. Charles the Bellman is one super wonderful man and the most honest and helpful person I know. Very good guy! Although I don't recall his name one Houseman from overnight really helped me out too, a few times! The staff here is kind, honest, incredible service oriented group and all I can say is, it is a wonderful feeling to come in and folks KNOW YOUR NAME! Our first night Gene called us by name when we arrived! They all deserve raises!

Reviews.Title: “~ The Lovely & Exquisite Hidden Gem ~ the Talbott”
Reviews.Author: janetleeschultheis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made a weekend jaunt to Chicago for a weekend in the city! When visiting Chicago, we enjoyed staying at the Talbott, due to the proximity of the Magnificent Mile shopping and the quaintness of the Talbott! It is a wonderful hotel in regard to decor, quiet, delightful Molton Brown bath amenities, internet and remarkable friendly hotel staff! We frequented the restaurant while staying there and the cuisine was scrumptious! They have an outdoor seating area as well! Lovely music wafts through the hotel and elevators, making you relaxed and ready to enjoy your wonderful stay at the Talbott!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: NMYankeeGal
Reviews.Content: Not all the modern amenities, but a charming hotel with SUPERB staff. I can't say enough about the warmth and professionalism of the staff from the front desk to the bellman to the concierge. Room was small but comfortable. Amenities were upscale but the furnishings/bathroom were just a regular hotel room. For the price though, I can't complain and we'd stay again. Hotel restaurant (Bice) was also quite good! Also great downtown location in walking distance to everything we wanted to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS PREMIER HOTEL IN THE HEART OF DOWNTOWN CHICAGO!”
Reviews.Author: cstrickln
Reviews.Content: This was a mini-vacation trip and we decided to experience The Talbott Hotel during one of our frequent visits to downtown Chicago. And a perfect experience it was! Friendly and accomodating staff and service! Our room was located on one of the upper floors, and it was extremely comfortable, and had a kind of "old world charm". HUGE Plasma TV with capabilities to connect/work to your personal computer. Fabulous bathroom. Perfect for romance or busines. Within walking distance to all the joys of downtown Chicago! Not one complaint!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in prime location”
Reviews.Author: Scott99
Reviews.Content: Stayed two weekday nights at The Talbott in early July for business and loved the hotel. It's ideal for either business or leisure stay, as the amenties are great - free internet projected via the HD TV - and although the rooms are on the small side, they're very tastefully decorated and the bed is very comfortable. Great hotel bar. Great, small boutique feel lobby - very nice staff. The location in downtown Chicago is perfect - an 8 min. walk to the lake and a 2 - 3 min. walk to a variety of very good restaurants and bars. Will definitely return to this hotel for a weekend getaway in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Agree, Horrible Elevator Noise, 16th floor!!!”
Reviews.Author: guest5663
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Talbott for two nights on a weekend, and was put on the 16th floor right next to the elevator. You can hear the elevator all day and most of the night, would not stay there again!!! The valet parking service was poor as well. The location is great, but that's about it....

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed all aspects of our stay.”
Reviews.Author: tpallcare
Reviews.Content: Extremely helpful staff, very convenient location, spacious and well appointed room. We surely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible elevator noise on 16th floor!”
Reviews.Author: lucky18
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms four months in advance at the Talbott. We were placed on the top floor next to the elevators, which are used all night long. When speaking to the front desk, I was told that they were simply honoring my request for an upper floor, which I had requested for a better view. I am looking at a brick wall, and getting no sleep. He also told me that they had received complaints before from guests on the 16th floor, and were aware of the noise problem. Why then did they place us on this floor when the hotel is not totally booked? A request for an upper floor does not constitute placing someone on the TOP floor and using that request to justify this. If you decide to stay here, request a room on a lower floor and away from the elevator! I spoke at length when booking my two rooms about my preferences. This is simply poor treatment of a guest whom they believed would not complain.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: ndbrit06
Reviews.Content: Nice and really great staff! Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: mgbr35805
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect! All staff members were top of the line! Service was above board! The room was perfect and the bedding was like sleeping on clouds! We will most definately be back to the Talbott Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The epitome of a wonderful, small, hotel”
Reviews.Author: jourdanj
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Talbot for 4 nights. Don't bother to look for another hotel in this price range. Just book your reservations! The room was spotless and spacious (a King Deluxe), the personel were gracious, helpful and friendly, and the neighborhood is beautiful and right in the heart of the delightful River North area.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable hotel, poor service, poor value.”
Reviews.Author: sarahloul
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel in the "Small Luxury Hotels of the World" booklet having stayed in many of these in recent years, and they were indeed above and beyond average hotels. I therefore chose it for a 4 night stay while visiting from England. The Talbott was excellently located, although i had a view of a building site, and did have an ambience and some charm, however it was a little dirty and faded around the edges and the service was appalling. I had to wait in the foyer well after check in time, having previously attempted to check in earlier, tired and in need of a rest, while a "final check" was done to my room. The valet parking was not outside when requested, breakfast was not included in the price, all the things requested of reception did not occur, and there were very few touches which make a hotel stay special. I have stayed in hotels which are so much more elegant, where the staff and service are first rate for half the price of this hotel. I was severely disappointed and cannot recommend it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Will be returning...”
Reviews.Author: Mandy1227
Reviews.Content: We were sent here due to the original hotel we had booked no longer could accommodate us due to the Chicago Bulls team winning a game and staying there (50+ rooms were excused for the Bulls over this weekend from the Sutton Place Hotel). The Talbott is second to none! They treat you as if you are family. The bellman and desk staff were fantastic. Everyone was very helpful and accommodating. We had breakfast room service one morning during our stay and it was great. We wished they would have had some type of small breakfast for the other mornings but we managed. Chocolates were on our pillows each night...so sweet. The rooms were very nice, clean, roomy, and comfortable. We are so thankful we were placed at the Talbott and will definitely be returning for our next Chicago visit!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Bad shower. No breakfast buffet.”
Reviews.Author: dobon
Reviews.Content: Boutique hotel in the Old English Style. Very well kept and clean. Also good location close to Mich. Av. and Hancock Tower. Large and nicely decorated room with efficient AC and comfortable beds. No streetnoise (10th floor). Could hear people talking in the corridor though. No views. The bathtub is so shallow as to be almost useless and the shower rather weak. Staff is polite, but not many smiles. No breakfast buffet. Only a la carte. The gym is not in the building. They will provide you with a daypass for a facility located i another building several blocks away, so it will not be used by many. On the bright side there is free wireless internet, albeit at reduced speed compared to paying cistomers. It was perfectly stable and adequate for my use though.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: philiphf
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend in Chicago celebrating my partner's birthday with friends. As all previous reviewers have stated, The Talbott delivered on all levels. Clean, friendly, elegant but relaxed, and large nicely decorated rooms. If there is one flaw with the hotel (and very slight), don't expect any grand views of the city. It sits mid-block surrounded by taller buildings. But it's location and comfort far outweigh the view out the window.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, elegant hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: jwh8847
Reviews.Content: We were torn between staying at a larger new hotel or the Talbott. So glad we chose the Talbott! It is a small but very elegant boutique hotel with loads of charm. The service was excellent, the bed was amazingly comfortable with exquisite linens. I also appreciated the hotel's efforts at energy conservation with extremely modern sensor thermostats that lower the temperature when guests are not in the room. The location is excellent, wonderful restaurants everywhere you turn, and don't forget a stop at Sprinkles Cupcakes for dessert!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for American Girl Experience”
Reviews.Author: AllAmericanGirls
Reviews.Content: My husband and I brought our girls here for their birthdays and chose the Talbott because of the wonderful American Girl package the hotel offers. The package we chose offered a horse and carriage ride from the hotel to the American Girl store (the ride is a 1/2 hour long though, you go for a ride before going to store)....what could be better than that for 5 and 6 year old princesses? Not to mention all the personalized welcome letters, keycards, room service menus, postcards and stationary custom for each girl. Also, they each received keepsake plush American girl doll beds, personal shopper Ensley at the store and cupcakes and milk delivered for each of our girls and dolls! Service was top notch, the hotel is right around the corner from American Girl, and right on a fantastic strip of shopping and dining. Overall, the experience was PERFECT. I felt I got what I paid for and never felt differently throughout our trip. The American girl experience is a newly added option to the Talbott and I felt they offered exceptional differences from other hotels. I recommended this package for anyone who wants the BEST American Girl experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel easy access to Rush Street”
Reviews.Author: smily21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Talbott this past weekend. What a great experience! The staff was courteous and kind from beginning to end. We pulled up to the Valet parking area and were greeted immediately, we were not told the difference in Valet vs. Self park, so we did the Valet. It ended up being 50 dollars which I thought was a bit steep but, oh well lesson learned. Our next stop was the front desk, the doorman took us in and introduced us to the "bellhop", then the front desk. We checked in quickly and were sent to the 4th floor. After further thought we should have asked for a higher floor to get a better view then an alley, but another time. The room was great, king size bed with down pillows and super soft sheets. The bathroom was spotless and well lit. The towels were large enough for two to use, if one wanted to. We had a good nights rest, considering that we were not in our own bed. We did have some outside noise that could be heard but it was after 6:00 am. All in all a great hotel, in a great area.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: jenbayler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Talbott for a friend's wedding at The Newberry Library. Our stay was fabulous, from the very moment we pulled up to the hotel. We were greeted by the valet who greeted us warmly and explained we could use the valet service to park our car or use the self park. He gave us prices for both and one pressure to use the hotel's service. He helped us to get our luggage and walked us into the hotel and told the person at the desk our name. We noticed the charm of the lobby, it was like an old fashioned hotel lobby from a black and white movie. It was warm and inviting with wood, greens and granite counters. We were quickly given our keys and our valet, who now we knew was DeWayne showed us to our rooms. DeWayne could not have been more gracious and welcoming. He asked about our stay and gave us several suggestions of things to do and see in the neighborhood. He showed us how to turn everything on and told us to call down for anything, even ice and they would bring it up. We order some lunch from room service (yes, we splurged!) the service was fast and each room has a little door bell! The food was very good and the coffee was very good. The young man who brought up our lunch was very nice chatting with us about the NCAA tournament and wishing us well with our stay. The room was cozy a king sizes bed decorated with warm greens, creams and browns. The beds was very clean and comfy. The room was lovely with Italian marble in the bathroom and dark wood dressers. When we started to get ready for the wedding, we realized we had forgotten some things, the concierge gave us some suggestions and was very helpful. Overall our stay was wonderful and relaxing...we cannot wait to go back and spend more time there!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique Hotel....Wonderful Choice for American Girl Trip or Anytime!”
Reviews.Author: jec96
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a lovely stay at the Talbott. My husband and I were traveling with our two children (9&6), as well as my mother-in-law, for a birthday trip to American Girl Place and other Chicago family attractions. After an early morning flight we were warmly greeted and told that our rooms were available for early check-in. We were also checked in personally by Tim, the head of the concierge staff, who took special time to greet my daughter (and her doll), wish her a happy birthday and tell us about the area. There were even personalized key cards with the names of my daughter and her doll at the bottom. The rooms were incredibly spacious, which was especially nice since we were often in one room to plan our day or to enjoy the terrific room service. The location of the hotel cannot be beat. We were about a six-minute walk to American Girl, the John Hancock Tower and wonderful shopping along Michigan Avenue, but were able to enjoy the quiet of being away from the hustle and bustle and the hospital. Both kids loved the ice skating at the top of the John Hancock Tower and the gourmet cupcakes at More right across the street from the hotel! We experienced all of the amenities you would expect with an American Girl hotel package (doll travel bed, cupcakes at turndown, etc.), but it was really the graciousness of the staff that made our stay extra special for all of us and truly sets the Talbott apart. The entire concierge staff went out of their way to make us feel at home.....everything from greeting us by name, offering opinions about the best Chicago pizza and making reservations, to arranging a car to the airport from the Field Museum so that we could make the most of our last day in town. The intimate, warm nature of the Talbott was exactly what I was hoping for on our special family trip. Everything exceeded my expectations. Many thanks to Tim, Gene and the entire staff at the Talbott for making us feel so welcome and at home, and for making my daughter feel truly celebrated. We cannot wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall great experience.”
Reviews.Author: nbottois
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel with great classic decor and an amazing group of staff. No on demand movies, pool, ect...

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about the Talbott!”
Reviews.Author: HMSnyder
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the Talbott.....loved it! The location is great for shopping, restaurants, bars. We were able to walk nearly everywhere. The interior is very European....classic touches with little leather couches, fire in the fireplace, small bar perfect for a night cap. The reception/bellman area was very quaint and allowed for personal greetings on your way in and out thruout the day. We paid the $49/night for valet parking which is comparable to other properties downtown...it was no hassle, drop off and pick up right at the door. The gentleman who worked the door was very pleasant and engaging. We really enjoyed him! The rooms at the Talbott are not large but adequate for the limited time spent there. The king bed was comfortable with lots of pillows. Turn down service nightly with little chocolates. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhilandSaraF
Reviews.Content: I booked the Talbott for my stay in Chicago as part of the International Home and Housewares Show in March 2011. The rate was very good and offered free WiFi, which I needed. The hotel was stylish and well appointed. The staff were very friendly, polite and always willing to assist. There were some minor housekeeping issues, which were quickly resolved by the hotel each time we mentioned it. The adjacent restaurant was going through a transitional upgrade so was not a viable option, but the bar there was great. You can access both through a side door from the hotel lobby. There is no breakfast available, but that suits me fine as I don't eat big breakfasts. There were Keurig coffee machines in the room and I purchased pastries from the Goddess and Grocer market across the street for breakfast. The area itself, the Gold Coast, is very nice. Near Rush and the Magnificent Mile, great shopping and plenty of good dining options a short walk away. It was a 20 minute walk down to the river area and more fun. Red line was a couple blocks away on State & Chicago. All in all I enjoyed my stay very much and will probably stay there next year for the Housewares show.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Christmas”
Reviews.Author: ggtw23
Reviews.Content: The windy city during winter can be a challenge to say the least but The Talbott Hotel was wonderful. The room was top notch, provided soft robes, and a spendid view. I enjoyed the fire place as I waited for business colleges and family to meet me in the lobby. The location was perfect for doing business near and around the Hancock building and was close enough to the Field Museum, Nazy Pier, and Shedd Aquarium. I'll be staying at the Talbott for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “like a luxurious home away from home”
Reviews.Author: da91
Reviews.Content: The Talbott Hotel has a long history and changed hands a number of years ago. It's clear the new European ownership has had a positive influence. I have never encountered a more friendly staff. The bed is fantastic. My suite had ample space and all the accoutrments one would expect from a good hotel. If I were to take exception with anything it would be that the shower was a little small. The location is perfect for shopping and dining. There are 3 elevators so getting in and out is not a problem. There is a wonderful room service menu. The lobby is outfitted with cozy seating and working fireplaces. This is a wonderful boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alfieinthekennel
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, spacious an dclean rooms. Breakfast was a bit disappointing. Location is good for exploring Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: hapetraveler
Reviews.Content: The Talbott Hotel is centrally located to everything downtown Chicago. Room was spacious, great toiletries and super comfy bed. Concierge was most helpful with specific directions on where to catch and where to exit the Underground when we wanted to go to Chinatown and then see Millenium Park. All hotel staff we encountered were warm and friendly. If you go, you MUST try Pizzano's which is literally right around the corner, and More (cupcakes) which is across the street from the hotel. In a word, YUM!
