Had a great lunch at The Gage across from Millenium Park - and if you go you have to try one of the Cherry Reikey (sp) drinks from the bar which is Belvedere vodka, muddled cherried and lime juice, So much to see and do, and weren't able to do it all in a quick weekend getaway, so we will return. And yes, we will go back to the Talbott Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First Stay - Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Gartartan
Reviews.Content: Over the years I have begun to seek out the smaller hotels on business trips - a reaction against the anonimity I have felt, even with the prestigious brands and membership of select schemes, in larger hotels - and the Talbott didn't disappoint. It was charming, not luxurious but generous in welcome and room proportion. I will be making it my home in Chicago on future trips - both business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Charm and Character in the Heart of the City!”
Reviews.Author: sarahabouttown
Reviews.Content: I visited Chicago with my mother for a week long stay of sightseeing and shopping. The Talbott was recommended to us by a friend and it did not disappoint. It's a beautiful hotel with a lot of old world charm. The room was very luxuriously decorated and the marble bathroom was spacious with double sinks. The hotel is very centrally located - a short walk to the Magnificent Mile and close enough to use transit or taxis for the rest. The staff were extremely helpful and attentive and they made us feel very welcome each time we left or came back to the hotel. Great hotel in the heart of Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service - Never a Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: IrelandGreenTraveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Talbot at least 6 times in that last 2 years and every time has been an absolute pleasure. The staff is friendly and helpful - we always feel welcome. The location makes it easy to grab a taxi or hop on the subway - close to downtown theatre (2 stops on the red line) or the art museum.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Talbot”
Reviews.Author: Clareinsguy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Talbot the weekend after Thanksgiving. It was a surprise for her on our 40th wedding anniversary. We have stayed in many different hotels in downtown Chicago but never a "boutique" hotel. We found the check in process seamless and quick. We had a beautiful room on the sixth floor overlooking Delaware. The hotel is near Michigan Ave so therefore close to shopping. The hotel was festively decorated for the holidays. The staff was very friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: luxdeluxe
Reviews.Content: My husband and i have been staying at The Talbott for nearly 20 years and we love it! The location can't be beat, of course, and the rooms are beautiful, especially the spacious marble baths. The fluffy down duvets are delightful too. The ever gracious staff is what sets The Talbott apart from the rest. You will be warmly greeted at the door by the bellmen, then experience the same personal touch at the front desk and the concierge desk. People who are happy doing their job and personally connected to your excellent experience, that's the big deal. I am attaching a photo of Gene at the concierge desk, just one of the good friends you will also make at The Talbott hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but positives for The Talbott Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RueClerzMyPlace
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Talbott Hotel for two nights--an anniversary getaway. I chose it based on TA reviews and price...it was a great choice. The staff was absolutely excellent both in performance and personality. We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite upon checkin from a deluxe king room. The rooms were huge--living room overlooking Delaware Street, bath with shower, tub, two sink/vanity areas, and every toiletry item we could have wanted. One of my favorite things...two big spa robes and enormous towels (and lots of them too). It rained one of our days in the city, but no problem because we even had umbrellas in our coat closet. We had breakfast at the adjoining restaurant--excellent. We love the location of the hotel and were able to walk everywhere. I am not usually so effusive with my compliments--check my other reviews--but this hotel was exceptional. Can't wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff in Gold Coast”
Reviews.Author: jolotraveler
Reviews.Content: The Tabott Hotel is a gem, located in Chicago's Gold Coast. The staff here are extremely friendly and helpful. This hotel is very comfortable. Located in the Gold Coast, you are slightly off the beaten path, but definitely within walking distance to all that Chicago has to offer. This hotel doesn't really have very many "frills", but it has all of the basics covered: great beds, clean, large bathrooms, comfortable rooms, and friendly staff. Oh...and the hotel has an agreement with Equinox gym, so you can go there for free. Definite plus!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay and surprise”
Reviews.Author: okiedave1945
Reviews.Content: I was surprised by my wife on my 65th birthday at the Talbott. Although frequent vistors to Chicago it was our first stay at The Talbott. Management and staff did an excellent job of keeping the surprise a secret as 19 family and friends from all over the US filtered in over several days. Our room was excellent and the entire staff was both friendly and accomodating. We have without a doubt found a new home when visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “This is a quality establishment”
Reviews.Author: Snorlaxxl
Reviews.Content: I had used the high quality of reviews for this establishment as a guide when I booked. They were not wrong. This is Hotel that has a restrained, understated style that comes with deserved confidence in the quality of their product. My room was spacious with excellent amenities, a large, comfortable bed and a sparkling bathroom. Service from staff was friendly and efficient wthout being over the top. The Hotel's location is good with easy access to Michigan Ave and many good quality eateries. I am looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “kept dropping the ball”
Reviews.Author: wandaMPa
Reviews.Content: First, Tim the concierge was great. It was sort of downhill after he made our reservations though. We asked for the WSJ to be delivered at 8 am and charged to the room. It was not. The housekeeping people came to do the turndown at 9:30 pm. AFTER we were in our pjs. The next day we left at 9 am and returned at 3:30 and the rooms were still not made up. We were going out and wanted to take a nap so called and said not to bother us and that we would be leaving for dinner at 6 pm -- they woke us up TWICE despite our telling them NOT to bother us. It will be interesting to see if the room gets cleaned while we are at dinner. We kept calling and assured that the manager would get back to us. Never did. This is a great location, but they need an overhaul on service for sure. I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Small Luxury Hotel In Chicago”
Reviews.Author: JohnCasper
Reviews.Content: I would like to compliment the Talbott Hotel after my incredible stay. My room was beautiful, roomy and luxurious. The Talbott staff was very friendly, especially Office Manager Sarah Yates, who answered every question and went out of her way to make my stay one of the best in Chicago. This truly is a five star hotel with an excellent location. I will make this hotel, my hotel of choice in Chicago and you should too.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Talbott!”
Reviews.Author: gsz1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Talbott many times. We appreciate their friendly, helpful staff, clean,well appointed rooms and convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, Affordable Hotel Option in Heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: JTravelBuddy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently and were blown away by the wonderful hotel rooms, the superior service, and great location. Dwayne (spelling?) greeted us at the door and was very helpful, suggesting options for dinner and things to do around the neighborhood, as well as taking the time to show us the features of our room (including the heated floors in the bathroom). The rest of the staff was great and very friendly too. People who like what they do treat their guests right, and they clearly do this at this hotel. The location is outstanding - about a block from the John Hancock building - and close to Michigan Avenue, the Chicago Art Institute, the Loop, etc. The room itself was huge by Chicago standards, with plenty of room. The room rate was about $225 per night on a busy fall weekend and the parking was $32 per night (self park) and located just around the corner. Only drawback was being in a room next to an alley way where they seemed to load trucks loudly at odd hours. No matter though, it was a great time in Chicago and we would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable and affordable hotel option in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely fabulous hotel, with wonderful Alicia at front desk and Kathy as concierge.”
Reviews.Author: juju78028
Reviews.Content: Much more than we expected, this hotel is gracious in every way. Suites are large, well appointed, with fabulous bathrooms. The staff, including the front desk, and the concierge were so helpful. A lovely, quiet and accomodating hotel, one of the very best! The Parkers

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Texasdomer
Reviews.Content: Room was nice. Not overly large but comfortable. Our view of the brick wall next door was the only downside to the stay. Would have been nice to see the skyline. Hotel staff was very friendly. It was nice to be able to go down a couple of blocks and use the gym during our stay. Very close to restaurants on Rush street. Close to shopping on the Magnificent Mile. And just a couple of blocks from the Red Line to catch the train up to Wrigley. We enjoyed the stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “More then expected.”
Reviews.Author: malkf
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out all was Plus 1. The reception was sincere and fast, bags to room and ice provided. The concierge provided really intersesting optionsand we had a great time trying out new places. This is a great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: rho72
Reviews.Content: First time poster but long time user of Trip Advisor. This was our 2nd trip to Chicago for our anniversary. Our stay was fantastic from start to finish (4 nights). This is a 1st rate boutique hotel in a fabulous location in the Gold Coast district of Chicago. We arrived early at the hotel (11 am) but were able to check in right away and received a complimentary upgrade to a 1 bedroom suite without even asking... The suite was fantastic (I would guess around 700-800 sq ft) with a separate living area and master bedroom. The suite was very clean, had turndown service every evening with nice chocolates, 2 flatscreen TVs, complimentary wireless internet (big plus), huge bathroom with separate shower, bathtub, double vanities, nice toiletries, huge plush bath towels, complimentary ice service, separate temp controls for the bedroom and living area. There was a locked minibar/fridge which we did not use (would have been nice to have some room to store our leftovers from the fabulous eating experiences we had). The hotel is in a very convenient location, 2 blocks from Michigan Avenue and 1 block from Rush Avenue (with lots of dining options). Walkable distance to the Navy Pier and Lincoln Park Zoo. Concierge (Tim) was very helpful with dining recommendations and reservations. Bellman (Dwayne) was excellent for general service and advice. Dining: Lunch: Pizano's -- excellent Chicago style deep dish pizza, a block away from hotel Ditka's -- great burgers, 1.5 blocks from hotel; really good crab bisque too Downtown Dogs/Pippin's Tavern on Rush -- good chicago style hot dogs and beer; about 3 blocks from the hotel Giordano's -- world famous stuffed pizza - excellent; 3 blocks from hotel Dinner: Bice Restaurant -- Italian; connected to hotel; average quality for us; although there seemed to be a lot of patrons on other nights Rosebud on Rush -- Italian; excellent; 3 blocks from hotel right by Giordano's Japonais -- sushi; 5-6 min cab ride; excellent, very fresh, chique atmosphere (recommendation from Tim -- thumbs up!) Devon Grille -- seafood; 3 blocks from hotel; excellent, wide variety (another excellent recommendation from Tim -- thumbs up!) Overall, we had a fantastic long weekend in Chicago. The Chicago Marathon (10-10-10) was cool to see. Lots of people out and about. Weather was great! We felt safe walking around the area of the hotel at night. Will definitely stay here on return visits. Kudos!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Bear66
Reviews.Content: The Talbott is a wonderful small hotel. The service was outstanding, beds comfortable, and room quiet. Also, it was extremely clean. The location is excellent - we felt safe walking around at night. I stay in Chicago quite a bit at many hotels - none, even the Intercontinental, hold a candle to the Talbott.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: penguin2634
Reviews.Content: Our group of 25 women (all co-workers) stayed at The Talbott Hotel the weekend after Labor Day. We had the best time. The Talbott is in the most perfect location to Michigan Ave & the well known Rush St which is where the nightlife is. The Hotel was wonderful, huge rooms, very clean, very small & quaint. The hotel has seating for their restaurant outside on the sidewalk, sitting out there at night was one of our favorite things to do. We all just loved our stay here, you will love it too. Also, big thanks to the front desk person who actually gave me a coupon for the bagel shop down the street when I asked for directions to get there, who does that?? That's going above & beyond! Thank's Talbott, you made our stay fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: grandchildren4
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in until check-out the staff was amazing. Everyone was so helpful starting with the bellboy Perry when we checked in -- he was a fountain of information. The conceirge Tim had lots of ideas and coupons for us. I prefer staying in a luxury hotel instead of one of the chain hotels because you get more personal service. The staff seems to remember everyone who is staying in the hotel. Dwayne would be outside each night as we returned from dinner to greet us. We flew Southwest so we needed to go on line 24 hours before to get out boarding passes but we were going to be at dinner at that time so we asked at the desk if they could do it for us and they said it was no problem. When we returned from dinner they had them there waiting for us. Many times I don't sleep well on vacation but I had no problem sleeping at the Talbott because the beds were so comfortable.(Actually asked what kind of mattress they use) The rooms were decorated with lovely furniture and drapes and we had plenty of space for all of our luggage. Two of us shared a room and we liked the double sinks in the bathroom so we could both get ready at the same time. This was our first trip to Chicago but we are thinking of making it an annual trip and definitely staying at the Talbott Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could They Be Any Nicer ?”
Reviews.Author: Jacq047
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four days at The Talbott Hotel in Chicago. It's hard to get back into "normal" everyday life after being there. No matter whom we dealt with, everyone was so friendly and helpful. The hotel is immaculate in every area. The decor is gorgeous and very restful. The concierge staff is limitless with their suggestions. Everyone who is employed there seems to actually enjoy being there and it shows in their demeanor. They could even direct me to Macy's to buy Frango mints !! It's conveniently located to lots in Chicago. Don't miss going up to the John Hancock building down the street. The Molton Brown toiletries are lovely. Thanks to everyone there.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Staff”
Reviews.Author: Foxtripper
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a first time trip to Chicago with 3 of my friends. Chose the Talbott because of it's location and because we prefer smaller hotels. We were not disappointed! I don't think I've ever encountered such a friendly and helpful staff. The rooms were spotless, comfortable, large, and well appointed. The bellmen were not only efficient but gave us many tips about getting around the city. The concierge was superior giving us fantastic ideas of what to see and do , arranging for tickets and even giving us discount coupons for our shopping. We even met the general manager who made sure all of needs were being met. The location of the hotel is wonderful - 2 blocks from the "magnificent mile" and an easy cab ride to all of the museums and parks. I gave it 5 stars but it deserves 10.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous boutique hotel close to everything - is tops.”
Reviews.Author: The_Blonde_Beach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved the Talbott. It is small and elegant. The staff is friendly and fantastic. We felt so welcome here and miss it. We since went to Washington DC, Michigan City and are now in New York and no other hotel that we have stayed in is as good as the Talbott. Rooms are spacious, bathroom has two sinks. Shopping, restaurants and sight seeing are all within easy and picturesque walking distance. Chicago is a beautiful city. It's clean, safe and friendly and so very pretty. I even got hugs from the doormen (thanks Dwayne and Charles). I could not fault this place. All hotels could take lessons from this place. By the way, if you are reading this Gene, you know who I am. I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: northwest1
Reviews.Content: 3 night stay, booked through SLH, the location is excellent, the room we had and the general decor is a little heavy but no complaints, all clean and tidy, we had the benefit of a room upgrade which was nice. The service is really good, all the staff are friendly and attentive, we only had breakfast but the food was of a reasonable standard, the outside pavemnet cafe was great. I heard while there that plans are to extend the bar and restaurant, this can only improve the Hotel when done, overall only positive comments.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, great service”
Reviews.Author: mediamom99
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are small, they are beautifully appointed and clean. Bathroom counter had plenty of room for all our "stuff." The location is close to Michigan Avenue, but we enjoyed walking on Rush and other nearby streets away from the bustling crowds. The staff were all so friendly and helpful and we enjoyed our complimentary breakfast at Bice each morning. I would most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Talbott: Above and Beyond!"”
Reviews.Author: JoMich
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Talbott Aug. 1st as the beginning of my husband's 50th birthday celebration (we flew to Cozumel the next day and stayed at the amazing Cozumel Palace Resort--see my review). This was our 3rd year of staying at the Talbott, and because I'm a hopeless romantic, I asked for the same room we'd had the previous 2 years. The Asst. Mgr., James, said that unfortunately, the room was occupied, but that he had one he thought we'd like. He surprised us by upgrading us to a 1 bdrm. suite for no extra charge and graciously, wouldn't even allow us to tip him! The suite was magnificent--we couldn't have asked for a lovelier room. Like the entire hotel, it was elegant without being ostentatious. That is the Talbott in a nutshell--understated elegance. The incredible service, immaculate and beautifully appointed rooms, location, and overall feel ensure that we will always continue to return to the Talbott--our favorite hotel in Chicago:-)

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place to stay in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: mgellmanbreil
Reviews.Content: Wonderful in all accounts. Great linens and towels, clean, friendly service. Great location. Small and private. My kids felt welcome as well! I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: demaru
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. I loved the decor of the hotel. The location is perfect for tourists and a person like me who have lived in the city before and know how to get around the city by public transportation. You can easily access to the red line and #22 and 36 bus to Lincoln park/ wrigleyville area for night out. The concierge service, especially Gene was so helpful. I just did not like one staff at the front desk, a blonde girl, she was not much helpful when I asked her small help. Other than that, I really liked our stay and I highly recommend this hotel to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Totally Average Property”
Reviews.Author: qaz123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located, just a block off of the craziness of Michigan Avenue, on a block with several restaurants and shops. For a tourist who wants to be close to Michigan Avenue but not right on it, this is a fantastic location. It's a shame, then, about the physical facilities. There are only two small elevators servicing the entire hotel, one of which is also used by the service staff. This is a pretty vertical hotel, which means you'll spend lots of time waiting for the elevator if the hotel is busy, which it was the weekend we visited. In addition, the size, shape and quality of the rooms varies widely. Our room was small, with a miniscule motel-like bathroom, and a view into a dark air shaft. We saw some other rooms of the same category and noticed that they were of quite a bit larger, with significantly larger bathrooms. If you don't like your room, request another one. The beds were also somewhat uncomfortable. Breakfast at the hotel restaurant (Bice) was included in our rate and the level of service in the restaurant was subpar and generally disorganized. All that said, the rooms and the hotel generally were quite clean and the staff was friendly. There is no gym, but they give you free passes to the Equinox 5 minutes away. Chicago is a city with some fantastic hotels--this, unfortunately, is not one of them. However, for the right price, it might worth a look for the location alone.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: motownmanDetroit
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Chicago and I really have the Tripadvisor to thank for us picking out this hotel. Everything was great. My wife and I had a King Deluxe room and it was very spacious. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was very big and clean. A large, deep tub for bathing and a seperate shower stall which also was very clean. The bathroom had a double sink and plenty of counter space. The room was quiet and we heard no outside noise. The television was a 42 inch and the reception was good, my only complaint was that there weren't too many channels but it had all the basics. Gene and Karen from the concierge were terriffic! They were very friendly and helped my wife and I out with our sightseeing and gave us plenty of tips and information. The employee's at the front desk were also friendly and helpful. Overall, our stay was very relaxing and enjoyable and we would definitely stay there again when we visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Luxury Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SallyG2
Reviews.Content: The Talbott is a great place to stay. It is a luxury boutique in the heart of the Gold Coast, easily within walking distance of Michigan Avenue, State Street, and Navy Pier. The staff is exceptionally friendly. They provide twenty-four-hour room service, concierge service, and the front desk staff and waitstaff are even cheerful late at night. The rooms are modern, well decorated, and comfortable. They feature flat-screen sattelite televisions, ihome alarm clocks, and many other conveniences one would expect from a luxury hotel, without the sameness of the chains.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service.”
Reviews.Author: jillianmarie83
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome stay at the Talbott. Our plane got in at 8am so when we dropped our bags off at the hotel they informed us that as soon as a room was available they would call us. They called soon after and let us in our room three hours before our scheduled check-in time. Our room was beautiful and throughout our whole stay the staff was super friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service from a Beautiful Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: yellows55
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far the most impressive I have ever stayed in - I only stay at 4star properties so I consider that to be a great achievement. From the minute I got there, the bellman introduced himself and gave me a quick overview of the hotel layout as he led me to the front desk. There is a fireplace on the left that looked oh so comfortable and a cute restaurant downstairs. The concierge was very pleasant and detailed. She gave me some suggestions about what to do nearby, and informed me that they give free daily passes to work out at an Equinox down the block which I thought was cool. She checked me in efficiently and gave me my room keys. My room was so cozy, I did not want to leave!! The decor was a modern take on what I think an inn should be. The room had a sensor that turned on the lights when you walk in and off when you walked out.. There was an oversized king bed(with a canopy) that felt like heaven to be in. There is even a housekeeping indicator on the wall to alert housekeeping if you need service. I ordered room service from the restaurant downstairs and when they got upstairs - ding dong - there is a doorbell on my door!! I had no idea and i thought it was awesome - I hate knocking sounds!! My only complaint is about their internet connection(i only used the wireless connection). It was free, and they have multiple networks available but none of them seemed to have a strong signal. Overall, I loved it! I would live there if I could!!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great position, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: dollyddraws
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. You are welcomed at every turn by the staff and you feel it is sincere. The concierges are beyond helpful, they were superb. We had just travelled from Alaska and it was wonderful to feel a little luxury again. I would stay there in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable historic hotel very near the Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: dncatl01
Reviews.Content: The Talbott is a small historic hotel much in the style of the grand old wood-panelled hotel but just on a smaller scale. The service we received at the front desk and from the concierge was excellent, and they allowed us to check in significantly early. It is very conveniently located, close to Michigan Ave dining and shopping and 2 blocks from the Red Line train stop at Chicago Ave. I stayed there for $154/night, which was a phenomenal rate. Although the hotel has been updated, it does show signs of age, with suboptimal climate control, a small bathroom, and a mild musty smell. The hairdryer was also substandard for a hotel of this calibre. Otherwise, we greatly enjoyed our stay here for its value and old-school charm.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago: My kind of town”
Reviews.Author: tmp119
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a great location. Convenient to bus and train. Room was beautiful, and the staff was very helpful and polite. Lots of good restuarants in the area. Loved this quaint little Italian bakery/deli at the foot of the Hancock Bldg.; L"Appettito. Would definitely stay at the Talbott again. It you want to get tickets to shows, walk over to the tourist office by the water tower, and you can get 1/2 price same day tickets. Loved Chicago; lots to do there, and the people were very friendly. Suggest getting a Go Pass if plan to do the touristy activities while you are there; it is well worth it. Try some Garrett's popcorn, a Chicago Dog, and Chicago style pizza while you are there. Also, be sure to walk through the lovely parks: check out the Lincoln Park Zoo and the Buckingham Fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Crevlin
Reviews.Content: We were advised by a friend about this hotel. We were travelling with a nother couple. old friends, and we were delighted with this hotel. The staff were extremely courteous and friendly, the rooms were excellent, and the service efficient. It is a great location, and we would recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: omniomni
Reviews.Content: I had requested a quiet room several weeks in advance, yet was given a room facing the street from which I could hear traffic noise. I asked to be moved and was told that nothing was available until the next day. The next morning, prior to being moved to a quiet room, the toilet in my original room overflowed creating a large unsanitary flood. About an hour later I was moved to a room which did not face the street. The room was quiet but smaller and darker. The mattresses in each room were very firm, I would even say hard. I asked if any softer mattresses were available and was told that the mattresses were all the same. At checkout I tried to give the hotel a form of payment that differed from the card the room was reserved under, and this process was still not done correctly after 10 minutes, which seemed longer because the van to the airport was waiting right outside, with other passengers. (The cost was not correctly charged until almost a week later.) As recompense for the noise, flood, etc., the hotel offered exactly nothing. Not a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, amazing service. I would highly recommend the Talbott Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: emrnz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed in a 1 bedroom suite at the Talbot on mixed business/pleasure trip. We found the service to be exceptional, maybe in part because the Talbott is a smaller hotel. The location was perfect for us, within an easy walk of Michigan Ave shopping and the shopping and dining options in the Rush St/Gold Coast area. Our room was fantastic. Very comfortable bed, nice large bathroom with very high quality amenities. We found our room to be peaceful and quiet, and slept very well all 5 nights of our stay (the hotel staff were very helpful and accommodating when a winter storm meant we needed to extend our stay and extra night). The only possible fault I could find with our room was that it didn't have much of a view, but that wasn't too important when we could walk a couple of blocks to the lake and the sights of the Magnificent Mile. The maid service was excellent. We are returning to Chicago this week on another similar trip, and didn't even consider staying anywhere but the Talbott.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: RedHeadPeter
Reviews.Content: Friendly and efficient reception staff gave us the good news about the room upgrade and the breakfast credit as part of efficient check-in. Next morning they were equally friendly and efficient at tracking down the member of staff with the tiny screwdriver to repair my spectacles. Room was great, staff were friendly, informed and informative and very helpful. If and when I return to Chicago I shall look no further,

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MDeRousse
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this from the hotel, midway through a four day stay, and find very little about the Talbott that is remarkable. They seem to have taken the "green" message too far, especially regarding lighting. With every light switch turned on, one still feels like you are in a cave. The bathroom is especially dreary. Rooms are smallish. I've been told the room I'm in is the standard, and that I'm fortunate to be in this one as it is quiet. The room is relatively quiet, the bed linens pillows are nice, room is clean. There is but one electric outlet available, and that is only at a desk not near the bed. I have visited Chicago at least annually for thirty-five years. This is one of the more forgettable hotel stays.

Reviews.Title: “A Chicago Treasure!”
Reviews.Author: JoMich
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Talbott Hotel 2 years in a row and we absolutely LOVE it! The King rooms are gorgeous and impeccably maintained, the staff are friendly and helpful, and the location can't be beat! It has become our favorite place to stay in Chicago--a boutique hotel far removed from the generic and massive chain hotels where we've often stayed. The Talbott is the perfect place for a romantic getaway--I can't recommend it enough!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but the service needs work”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFr0mDC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a short weekend trip and was very pleased with my stay. The best thing about the hotel is its location -- just a couple blocks from Michigan Ave and near lots of nice stores, perfect for a Chicago shopping trip. Also the room rate (from the hotel's website) was pretty low compared to comparable hotels in the area. The room was not huge, but generally nice; though, the bathroom was small and could use some updating. My only real negative comment is the service. The front desk personnel seemed uninterested in serving guests and often left me standing there while they shuffled papers before looking up to acknowledge me. However, given the location, price and quality of the hotel in general, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lacked friendly first class service”
Reviews.Author: ProSpotter
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at a small hotel because we did were looking for a hotel with less crowds. We anticipated we would get better service in a smaller hotel, than some of the other larger high rise hotels. We did not experience very good service at the Talbott Hotel. When we checked Irena seemed very robotic and aloof. The front desk clerks were neither welcoming nor gracious. The lobby is small and the front desk is just a few feet from the front door. Each time we came into the hotel we were never greeted nor even received a smile from the staff, just a blank stare and gaze. The front desk staff was chilly and stiff, no greetings, no smiles and no personality. They had difficulty answering simple questions or requests. On the other hand the bellman Perry was great. He was sociable and very service oriented. He was aware of what is going on in the area. He recognizes the guests and he offered suggestions about things to do in the immediate area, and where to eat in the neighborhood. He is authentic and he even asked us upon our return â€œhow was that restaurant?â€� Tim the concierge was also supportive. He gave us 10% discount coupons for shopping at the major department stores. We had the largest suite. We requested a rollaway (extra charge) when we made our reservation and we had to ask five different times to have the rollaway bed delivered to our room before it came after 10PM. When the rollaway finally came we had to call back the front desk because they did not deliver a blanket or pillow with the bed. What made our Talbott hotel experience most disappointing was that we may have never received any housekeeping unless we had asked to have our room cleaned. We were out of our room from 8AM and when we returned to our room at 4PM the rooms had not been cleaned. We called the front desk to ask to send someone. The maid rushed to clean our room while we had to shower and change for the evening. The room itself was pleasant. It did have a moldy smell and some Frabreez would have been nice to bring along since the windows do not open much. We were next to a noisy neighbor and the walls were thin. We really liked staying in this area of Chicago but expected first rate service. The service was very weak and unacceptable for this class of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet my expectations a very average hotel .”
Reviews.Author: veryaverage
Reviews.Content: Door men very friendly . Concierge good . Front desk service inconsistent. Promised a call when room was ready but no call received. Room once ready was a big disappointment..very small . Not sure why this hotel is rated so highly .. a very average hotel

Reviews.Title: “Superb friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Worlwide
Reviews.Content: What distinguishes the Talbott from so many similar hotels is the superb service offered by all the staff. Without exception, from the day we checked in, until we finally said goodbye eight days later than planned due to the volcano eruption, we were treated as welcome guests. Nothing was too much trouble for these lovely people. Particular mention should be made of the three friendly and knowledgeable concierges, of the doormen who always had a friendly greeting, and of those on reception who always managed to smile and have a room available for us. All the hotels highly recommended in Tripadvisor offer clean, comfortable rooms, beds, and bathrooms, and the Talbott Hotel is no exception. Some rooms are rather small, perhaps a little drab and dark, and they do not have splendid views, but they have large TV screens and are more than adequate for the average traveler. Free wi fi and coffee making facilities are provided in all rooms, a newspaper is delivered each morning, and there is an evening turn down service. The small restaurant is limited, and a wider selection of teas and coffees would be nice, but there are many restaurants nearby. Situated close to the Water Tower and Michigan Ave., the Talbott Hotel offers really excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it = Great value”
Reviews.Author: bold_advisor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend. It was unbelievable. I got a deal on the room on the hotel's Web site to stay for $195 with a free suite upgrade and $30 breakfast credit. The staff at the hotel was very friendly upon arriving and we found that to be consistent throughout the trip. The housekeeping staff and the maintenance staff even greeted us and told us to enjoy our stay. The one exception on the service was the awful service coming from the restaurant's breakfast staff. I don't know if they are resentful of everyone taking advantage of the free breakfast offer or what. They were not attentive or courteous. The first day, I think they were understaffed and we just stood at the door waiting to be seated for like five minutes. We had tried to try to just sit down and one of the waiters shoo'd us outside to wait by the maitre d table. The seating arrangements in there are awful as well. You sit right on top of the people at the next table. The food at breakfast, however, was really good I thought. My husband ordered the steak and eggs one day and didn't like the steak very much otherwise the menu was great and the food was delicious. We tried stuff french toast, omelets, eggs, and pancakes. The room was the best part. We stayed in a suite on the top floor. It was huge. The bathroom had a beautiful jacuzzi tub. They had bathrobes and the bathroom was all marble with two separate vanities and a small flat screen in the bathroom. The bedroom was great. Bed was super comfortable with a great TV. The living room had a wet bar, large desk and sofa with chairs facing another big flat screen TV. The location was really convenience too. Very close to Magnificent Mile and near the John Hancock building. We found it easy to arrive via the subway to and from the airport. Best features: free suite upgrade/breakfast, room was beautiful, convenient, good value Worst: service at breakfast was awful.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: Nina79UK
Reviews.Content: I do not normally write reviews but I thought it is worth giving my opinion on this hotel since it has been rated as the number 1 and it has not lived up to expectation, at least for me. It also won some awards. I was therefore really looking forward to this stay. For context, I have stayed in one of their suites. Overall, slightly disappointed but still a comfortable stay. I would only get this hotel if they upgrade you to a suite and you are prepared to go somewhere else for food. Good Points: 1. The suite is sizable and clean 2. The furnishings are in good condition 3. Great location for those who like to shop - on the doorstep of the Magnificent Mile Disappointed with: 1. Lobby was small and looked tired 2. I could barely understand the service staff as most were foreigners 3. The restaurant is small and poorly serviced. I did breakfast there, whilst I was seated quickly (I arrived early), some people had a long wait. I also observed one couple leaving their food because the waiter never brought the toast. The breakfast was poor - the omelet was at best basic and they gave a really small piece of toast. 4. The room service and restaurant menu is very limited, but after the first breakfast I didn't even want to try anything else anyway. 5. The room whilst large lacked the small touches which I would expect in a luxury hotel. It would have been nice to have slippers for example. The bathroom was large but the bathtub was very small. 6. On the first day the cleaning lady didn't turn up until quite late and that point I was already back in the room and didn't want to be disturbed. The second day I turned the button on for my room to be serviced, thinking they would attend to it quicker, but when I came back 3 hours later...the cleaning lady was just beginning. 7. The concierge was not very knowledgeable about tours of the city, I wanted a walking tour in a group and all he could recommend was a bus tour. I found out myself that you can join a walking tour for free throughout the weekend. 8. If you do choose this hotel and you are from Europe, do not take food recommendations from the staff. I think I have eaten the worst pizza of my life from PIzanos from around the corner. The base tasted and felt like it was fried and the toppings were tasteless. I felt ill after eating only a few slices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Richard-Caerdydd
Reviews.Content: Fantastic logation close to downtown and the Magnificent Mile. Lots of good restaurants within a few blocks especially Gibson which must be the best steakhouse in the world. Rooms large, well apointed and comfortable although traditional decor would not suit everyone. Breakfast was included in the deal, plenty of choice and it set us up well for the day. Gene the concierge was a great help with restaurants, the theatre and tours. Personal touch compared to large corporate chains and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service in the City!!!”
Reviews.Author: HappyJoyousFree090
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel on 20 E. Delaware in Chicago brings quality service to the next level in terms of guest service, committment, professionalism , and top notch customer service! I have worked in the industry,: catering, bartending, fine dining et al ,and was very impressed with the staff here! Perry makes you feel welcome,from the minute your toes touch the cement as you exit your cab! My stay here was warm, welcoming, and freindly. The towels are soft and huge, the bathrooms are clean and good sized. The front desk girls are courteous and professional. The service in the restaurant was fast and the food was very good. This small, quaint, charming hotel has the feel of home because of their staff, and because they treat you as they want to be treated..with respect. Forget the big hotels with an industrial feel.. my room had a huge HD TV, soft big pillows, a bed that I did not want to get out of the next morning, The turn down service, the houskeeping, and the managment will make want to stay here again and again! Amy Krouse from Northern Arizona. Word to the weary traveler: Do your self a kindess and stay here. I highly recommend it. Yes, I am picky,and found nothing but the best here.Quite impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Best Advice in Chicago... ...at the front entrance!”
Reviews.Author: manyshades
Reviews.Content: I have to say, what makes this hotel so highly recommended by me, are the people who run it. Mr Martinis, who mans the entrance, was an extremely welcome host to return to each day. His advice, ranging from what is cool in the area to where we should go in the next 5 minutes, was indispensable. Additionally, he and the other staff, were incredibly well presented, polite, friendly, approachable, knowledgeable and great just to chat to. I don't think I would have enjoyed my stay in the Windy City half as much if I didn't have such good local experts at my very doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: incitatus
Reviews.Content: When I travel to Chicago, as I do at least twice a year, I enjoy staying at the Talbott. It is easy to get to by vehicle and easy to navigate back to the highway. It is also centrally located in the Gold Coast area of the city, within easy and pleasant walking distance to shopping, restaurants, bars, and clubs. If you don't feel like walking, a cab is always only a hail away. During our two-night visit to the city, the weather was a bit rainy and cold. The hotel has umbrellas available for its guests' use near the front desk, which is a nice touch. They are free of charge. While parking is a bit expensive if you valet, it's really the way to go. The valet suggested that we call at least 20 minutes to a half-hour in advance of wishing to pick up our vehicle, but it only took about 10 minutes from the time I called to the time I was able to pick up my car in front of the building. Check-in and check-out were pleasant experiences. I felt welcome, invited, and not in the least snubbed, which is an experience I have had at the Park Hyatt and the Sofitel. I would definitely stay here again: the price and the location are key. Service is excellent and can't be beat. 24-hour room service is a must-have for me and this place is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “As close to a perfect hotel stay as we have ever had!”
Reviews.Author: woodwindWI
Reviews.Content: From check-in and the lobby accommodations to the restaurant and the wonderful room, this was the only time we have stayed in a hotel and found absolutely nothing that marred the perfect feeling we had! Everyone was cheerful and helpful. The room is spacious and has everything you want and no extras that just get in the way. The bathroom is large, well appointed, linens wonderful. We just had a wonderful experience. And the location is superb just a couple of blocks from Michigan Ave. I cannot say enough nice things about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mspang
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Talbott for two nights. The service was amazing. The concierge, both Gene and Tim, were so helpful. They suggested wonderful restaurants, a great jazz club around the corner and provided other useful information. The bellmen, especially Robert, was also welcoming and friendly. We had some cold, rainy weather on Saturday and it was so nice to come in and sit by the fire in the lobby area. We had a parlor king room that was spacious and quiet - the bed was very comfortable. The breakfast in Bice was great especially the stuffed french toast. Nothing but good things to say about this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: deltru
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a romantic weekend. It was our second time at the hotel and our second excellent experience. the location provides fantastic access to everything you could want... shopping, dining, nightlife. Our room was nicely decorated, clean and spacious. The staff went out of their way to be helpful. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: shane560
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Chicago and I was blown away by the Talbott Hotel. I decided to stay at the hotel after reading great reviews on this website and I was NOT dissapointed. I've stayed at top hotels around the world and this hotel ranks in my top 5. The hotel is small so every guest is given exceptional guest service. Everybody from Gary the concierge, the maids, the front desk, and the bartenders were OUTSTANDING. This hotel is situated in a perfect location. There are lots of restaurants, shopping, and nightlife close by. My wife and I can't wait to go back to the Talbott! Thanks for a memorable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “The Talbott misrepresents their special breakfast credit program and their upgrade program”
Reviews.Author: texan100
Reviews.Content: Staff is not familiar with the various offers the hotel advertises and therefore do not present the programs accurately at checkin and then refuse to offer the discounts. Evident lack of training and empowerment for the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but a little worn in places”
Reviews.Author: Cilantro_and_Lime
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed four nights at the Talbott for a girls get-away. There are lots of great hotels in the area, but we chose the Talbott after reading the reviews. I think I might want to try somewhere else next time, although this is a very good place to stay. Confused? Let me outline the pros and cons. The good bit first. The location and service at the Talbott is exceptional. You're within easy reach of some great restaurants and the best shopping is close at hand. The staff are very friendly and attentive, the concierge extremely helpful. There wasn't much of a view from our window, and the room was dark, but as we were out for most of the day, that didn't really matter. Our two-bed Queen room was spacious, giving us plenty of room to spread out. The down-side. Although you have access to a near-by fitness club, there isn't any at the hotel itself, which for me wasn't great. To be fair, one doesn't expects that at a small boutique hotel, so there the rest has to be pretty fantastic to compensate for what you don't get. But the place needs a little sprucing up. It's all in the details. We sat next to the bussing cart in the breakfast room. Couldn't they find a place in the kitchen for the dirty dishes? The decor of our room was beginning to look a little shabby around the edges. There was some kind of white muck on the drapes that ought to have been obvious to the cleaning staff. Black mold was creeping around the tub edges just a little. The whole burgundy and hunter green motif looked a little tired. Although the bed linens were Frette, they hadn't seen an iron, and the pillows were small foam ones. If these details don't bother you, then you'll have a fine stay at the hotel. I guess from the reviews I was expecting more. I'll try my luck somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay, can't say enough good things!”
Reviews.Author: redtulip99
Reviews.Content: We came downtown to celebrate our anniversary. From the minute we walked in the door we were well taken care of. The staff was very friendly & helpful & the rooms were wonderful! The special price drew us in initially but the amenities will bring us back. The rooms were spacious, clean, well decorated. Best value for a GREAT hotel in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mairbren
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel thanks to TripAdvisor and was not disappointed. The room was large with 2 queen beds. The restaurant in the hotel was good, and we ate both lunch and dinner there. The hotel is located close to the Magnificent Mile, but far enough away that it was nice and quiet at night. The staff were friendly, helpful and always curtious. Wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Personal touches”
Reviews.Author: joyals
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently on a girlfriend weekend. We not only enjoyed the cleanliness of the hotel, but all the personal touches and helpful staff members (from check-in to turn down service; to the chocolates delivered to our door and the friendly concierge). In spite of being close to the elevator we NEVER heard anything in the hallway, however staying on the alley side is not recommended because it was loud. The bedding was very comfortable, and I enjoyed having several pillows! Next time a romantic trip with my husband will be the reason for my stay! Great location off the mile and conveniently located to everything we planned to do (shop, dine and explore). Thank you for everything!

Reviews.Title: “A Room with A View!”
Reviews.Author: karmamama
Reviews.Content: Initially, after checking in to our room, I was a little disappointed by the view, or really, lack of view. It was my first visit to Chicago and all I could see out of my room, was a wall! After I called down to the front desk, asking about a room with a bit more of a view...we were upgraded, to a very large room with lots of windows, facing the street. Very comfortable hotel. Couple of quibbles; their breakfast is really pathetic....supermarket quality sliced breads, unappetizing cold cuts. We went to The Tempo Cafe instead, be warned, it's cash only, but excellent. Other quibble; we got a recommendation for a local restaurant, which turned out to be pretentious and expensive, with forgettable food. The Talbott Hotel, itself, is really terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay & Great Value”
Reviews.Author: jdr132
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Talbott Hotel for one night in February 2010 as I had a business meeting in Chicago. The only reason I selected the Talbott was because of the positive reviews here on Tripadvisor. I was not disappointed and had a very nice stay. Pros -Location: It's close to everything most people would want in Downtown Chicago. Also, there's a Walgreen's right around the corner if you need anything as opposed to raiding the minibar in the room.. -Size: I hate huge hotels. The Tablott is smaller and does not feel crowded. -Service: The people here are so nice and treated me with great respect. They really made me feel like a valued guest. -Decor: It has a nice look. Everything seems newer and is tastefully decorated. -Rooms: Decent size room with a desk, nice bed and linens, and a 40" flat screen TV with 20+ HD channels. -Price: I still can't believe the room cost only $132! Cons (nothing too bad, I am nitpicking here) -The view out my window was another building a few feet away, I guess that's normal for a smaller building in a big city. -Although free, the internet speed was slow. They have free internet and paid internet which is supposed to be faster. I did not pay for the service, and the free internet is too slow. As I was here for only one night, I did not get to try the other amenities like the restaurant or fitness center, but the concierge was very nice and helpful with making a dinner reservation. I would have no problem with staying here again on a future trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: officer99
Reviews.Content: Trip advisor was dead on by recommending the talbott hotel!!! The Talbott is one of the best kept secrets in Chicago; I was very pleased with the staff-- other hotels should tear a page out of the Talbott to truly understand excellence on every level! The staff was wonderful, the Valentine package was worth more than what we paid and the room was impeccable. Jean, Tim, Perry, Sarah and Andrew among others reminded me of what quality service really means. I definately recommed this hotel and I hope that many others will read the reviews and learn of Chicago's Best Kept Secret!!! Sshh

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel and at a remarkable rate”
Reviews.Author: Agro84
Reviews.Content: We spent last weekend at the Talbott to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary. A terrific boutique hotel. We took a suite that was spacious, well-appointed and clean, all for under $250 a night. Great bedroom with an extremely comfortable king. This hotel is a real find. The staff was excellent; friendly, well-spoken and knowledgeable. Concierge service was perfect, scoring us tickets to Second City and reservations at a nearby restaurant. The common areas are small but intimate and very comfortable. One, located right next to the Italian restaurant, Bice, has a nice fireplace and two stuffed chairs. Perfect for a leisurely glass of wine. The hotel is in an excellent location; two blocks west from North Michigan Avenue, and two blocks north of Water Tower, making it close to the major shopping areas. Despite being in the middle of a very busy part of the city, the interior of the hotel is extremely quiet. For those who need it, however, there is no glitz. Just reserved, cozy comfort. We visit Chicago often. I now know where we'll stay when we want to be in the Water Tower area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel â€“ Excellent service from all staff”
Reviews.Author: love-2-travel_2820
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a lovely shopping trip to Chicago. It is a very nice hotel, and I will love to stay there if I visit Chicago again! There is a lot of positive to say about the hotel; staff is excellent, never experienced such an excellent service â€“ that alone is worth coming back for. Was pleasantly surprised that the room rate was including breakfast. A few things that could make this hotel even betterâ€¦ A hand shower in the bathroom. The hairdryer to be placed in the bedroom, instead of the bathroom, when the bathroom is all damp after a shower I prefer leaving the bathroom to dry my hair. Free internet access in the lobby. I was surprised I had to pay 6 or 7 USD (for 15 minutes) to log-on and check-in with my airline (only with a few airlines you can check-in without paying?!?!?!?)

Reviews.Title: “What every hotel should aspire to”
Reviews.Author: firstclasshobo
Reviews.Content: It's been a while since I stayed at a hotel I simply didn't want to leave. The staff was friendly, couldn't do enough for you, without the conditioned uniformity of the chains. The bathroom was heavenly: separate shower, deep tub, wonderful towels. The location is convenient to everything a real person might want or need, and close enough to the tourist attractions as well. The hotel oozes character and has a really good vibe. I can't wait to return to Chicago and the Talbott.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Freezing Chicago”
Reviews.Author: U646
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Talbott Friday thru Monday. We took the train from Midway Airport to State Street Station and walked the short distance to The Talbott. The front desk employees were great and our room was ready, we arrived about 1:00pm. We ventured out to Rush Street and grabbed lunch at Carmines. What a wonderful find. Right across the street from the hotel is MORE Cupcakes. Certainly worth stopping by. The concierge Tim was outstanding. We were looking for a local bar to watch a football game, Tim mentioned Pizano's right on State St. THE BEST THIN CRUST PIZZA ! It was only steps from the hotel and the bartender was memorable. Tim also directed us to the Underground Bar for live late night music. It too was right around the corner. The last night we has dinner at Gibson's Steakhouse on Rush Street. Great steak and large sides. Very professional staff and service. This too was about a 5 minute walk from The Talbott. Our room was perfect and very large. We faced Delaware Street on the 10th floor. On the weekend a local paper was available in the lobby. On weekdays, USA Today at your door. We were provided a $15.00 credit per person each day for breakfast. This covered what we ordered each day. The bar/bistro where we had breakfast was also a evening destination for drinks. Perfect stay. Looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “The Talbott Hotel is the best”
Reviews.Author: pdrey
Reviews.Content: On a whim, we decided to spend New Years Eve in Chicago. We did a lot of research and settled on the Talbott. From the moment we arrived and saw the cow climing up the building to the moment we left, we were delighted about every aspect of our stay. The staff was incredible. Without fail, every single staff person we encountered smiled and greeted us and treated as if they were pleased we were spending our leisure dollars at their establishment. Such an easy way to impress customers...but so rare in the hospitality industry. The lobby was cozy and beautifully decorated for the holidays. Our room (the one room suite) was clean, comfortable, and full of extra amenities. The beds were comfortable, the linens felt wonderful, and the bathroom was outstanding. We loved the bathrobe and actually purchased one at checkout. We generally stay away from hotel restaurants, but we got behind schedule one evening and two mornings and found ourselves settling for the hotel restaurant. We were pleasantly surprised that the food was so good. For breakfast, we highly recommend the pancakes and the omlets. The only problem was a stale croissant on the second day. For dinner, we recommend the whitefish...it was outstanding. And of course, in keeping with the hotel standards, the staff was outstanding. The biggest miss of the weekend was the horrid internet connection. It didn't affect us much because we only used it to locate pubs, nightlife, and restaurants. But had we been there for work, it would have been a deal-breaker. Note to The Talbott...whoever is handling your internet service needs to be replaced. We are both in that line of work and it's not that tough. We will most certainly choose The Talbott Hotel the next time we visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a very good price”
Reviews.Author: MinnSam
Reviews.Content: Overall, this was a wonderful place to stay. The staff is professional and helpful. The beds were good and lighting was good. Only two slight drawbacks. The Bistro Bice, part of the hotel, was a little pricey for the food. The service was impecable and the coffee very good. The other problem was the hot water in the morning. If you are the first to shower it will be very chillly. Let the water run a long time and it will get hot. When the water is hot, the shower was great. I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The Talbott is Tops”
Reviews.Author: travel2C4fun
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first (but not last) stay at the Talbott. We found the hotel to be all that we expected. Early arrival, and they had our room ready...big plus (we had a sick child in tow). Each of the employees were so helpful and accomadating, especially Robert, Alecia, and both the concierge were very helpful. Always extra towels, and plenty of soaps, etc. in our room. A short walk or cab ride to so many activites, restaruants, etc. The rooms were very spacious and comfortable with several seating options, and a large flat screen. Queen beds are also a plus. The lobby, even though small, was very cozy and inviting. The breakfast in Bice was very enjoyable (now a $15 credit towards whatever was ordered. This was an online reservations benefit, may now be for all guest, not sure). We were very pleased with our experience at the Talbott and look forward to staying here on our next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at The Talbott”
Reviews.Author: obiecon
Reviews.Content: This was my second Christmas stay at the Talbott. I work very late every Christmas Eve and ever since my hot water failed one Dec. 24th, I've made a downtown hotel stay at this time of year a tradition. I tried The Fairmont a few years ago...before the renovation...And it had really gone downhill. It has now been renovated in IKEA style...YUCK! Then I discovered The Talbott! If you love traditional hotels, you will LOVE The Talbott. The lobby is all dark wood, has several fireplaces and, although small, it's comfortable and welcoming with intimate seating areas. Upon arrival, doormen are friendly and ready to assist you in any way. My check in was very fast, and all my special requests were met. I also asked for a mini-fridge which was sent up promptly and free of charge. Lovely Christmas decorations really made me feel at home since I don't get to see my family until Christmas day. I booked a 800 sq ft 1 br suite. The living room has a comfy couch, 3 chairs, coffee table, very large desk, and a 42 plasma TV. The marble bathrooms are HUGE! Jacuzzi tub, separate shower, 2 vanities, (both with hairdryer) separate commode room. Towels are soft and fluffy, but I found the robes to be a bit itchy. I prefer soft terry cloth robes. The bed was very comfortable with linens to die for. The bedroom has a 32" plasma TV and plenty of drawer and closet space. Free wireless internet was reliable and fast. A safe big enough for my laptop was very convenient. Room service breakfast was delivered quickly, but was a bit bland. There are certainly many restaurants in the area, and you couldn't ask for a better location...5 min from a subway stop and a 2 min walk to the mag mile. You will not get a better bang for your buck in Chicago than at The Talbott. Orbitz gave me a great rate of $182 a night! A similar suite at The Four Seasons or the Peninsula would cost you several times that.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful boutique hotel, great location, gem!”
Reviews.Author: jessicam40
Reviews.Content: We found everything at your property to be top notch! From the extremely helpful bell desk to the concierge, everyone was polite and eager to aide us in whatever we needed. The rooms â€“ wow! What beautifully appointed rooms and the size is very surprising for a small boutique hotel in downtown Chicago; very large rooms! The location is perfect, and I found it to be very accessible to sights, shopping, and transportation. We will suggest the property to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location...Great Value”
Reviews.Author: dre51
Reviews.Content: We took the advice of others and tried the Talbott. We agree that the location is ideal,only a few blocks to Michigan Avenue, Water Tower Place, Bloomingdale's (900 North) and Rush Street. We found the staff to be very professional and friendly. The corner room we had was very spacious, with a large sitting area as well as a large bath. It was very quiet (our room was at the back of the property). The only down side is the so-called free continental breakfast. It was pretty pathetic...some cold cuts, cheese, corn flakes, juice and coffee. Do yourself a huge favor and walk across the street to Feast. Their breakfast was fantastic and they also serve lunch and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: VAtraveler57
Reviews.Content: I had a sore throat and the hotel brought to my room a carafe and a microwave to make tea. WONDEFUL.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Home Base Near Shopping”
Reviews.Author: ashley627
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Talbott for two nights in November 2009. It was a great home base for exploring downtown Chicago, just a block from the shops on Michigan Avenue and a short cab ride to the Art Institute and Navy Pier. Our room was on the smallish side but comfortable and clean. My only complaint was the bed linens, which consisted of a duvet and decorative throw (no top sheet). I prefer a bit more weight/substance, and even at 5'4" I had to choose whether to cover my shoulders or my feet. One tip: Skip the continental breakfast. It's a European-style spread and features only yogurt, bread, cereal, sliced meats and sliced cheeses.

Reviews.Title: “The Talbott was great!”
Reviews.Author: LoriAnney
Reviews.Content: We chose the Talbott for a family weekend in Chicago and it was perfect. The location was wonderful, just a block and a half from Michigan Ave., very close to shopping and restaurants. The staff were very friendly and helpful with suggestions and reservations. The rooms were very large and well-appointed. We shopped at nearby Sur la Table, Urban Outfitters, Anthropologie, Bloomingdale's,and Water Tower Place. We had fun and good family dinners at the Big Bowl and Cheesecake Factory.

Reviews.Title: “Great Suite in Best Location”
Reviews.Author: PineRidgePlayers
Reviews.Content: We have 2 young children so we stayed in a king one bedroom suite with adjoining standard room. This gave us two seperate bedrooms and a living room w/desk. Loved the rooms. Big, very nice furniture, great TV's, and very clean. Across the street is Starbucks. Grocery with good deli & wine just around the corner and Walgreens 1 block north. Try Bar Luxe for breakfast. Food is great, it's two blocks north, and no wait. We are in Chicago every couple months. We've stayed at Embassy Suites (simple, rooms too small), Four Seasons (nice but no nicer than the Talbott for 1/2 the price), Hotel Monaco (also very nice). In the future, we'll be spending most visits at The Talbott.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Location”
Reviews.Author: Eileen C
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in October to celebrate my husbands 50th birthday. Doormen and bell boys were excellent. Front desk staff a little aloof but professional. Room was very comfortable and immaculately kept by housekeeping. Agreed with other travelers comments about breakfast - why bother when it does nothing to enhance the stay and the "elevator" music in the cramped and badly lit breakfast room at 8am is just too much!! Just two little niggles - got a better rate 3 weeks before arrival than I did when I had booked 4 months prior. In addition they paid no attention to the comment that we were celebrating a special occasion. Some little extra touches would have steered me towards excellent rather than very good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Clinton1
Reviews.Content: We first want to congratulate and thank their concierge staff. Before we even got there, Stephanie was a huge help. She treated us like gold and read our needs correctly. Very nice person. Gene also was helpful while we were there. The check in was terrific and the guy was very friendly and he upgraded us without us knowing. Did not realize it until we were in the room. The bellmen during check in and during our trip were very friendly and helpful. The Room was great. Well cleaned but when we had used some coffee mugs and glasses it took them a while to replace. There is a restuarant on premise called Bice Bistro. We got back from our restaurant on Saturday night at about eleven and the bar was closed. We were told Talbot was not a destination place. Seems like if they marketed that more, it would be another revenue stream, especially with all the new condos and apartments in the area. Now to the wourse part of the Talbot. That breakfast you get when you register on line is not worth it at all. Continetal breakfasts at Holiday Inn Express, Hilton Gardens etc are much better. In fact, if I were the Talbot I wouldn't do it. No fruit, cereal that was for kids, restocking for bowls for cereal, no bagels, just toast. We ate there one of three mornings and that was all we could take. We loved the Frette bedding and towels. Top notch. Aveda products were terrific also. . We loved the location. Kind of a quiet side street. Heard a lot from folks on this message board about construction. Yes it is going on but it is not the Talbot's fault. It isn't that bad anyhow. Their lobby is small but very quaint. Nice fireplaces to sit close to with a cocktail. Finally we had a temperature problem and hair dryer problem with our room and when we called, it was fixed right away. It was a great three days.

Reviews.Title: “Bring an alarm clock”
Reviews.Author: MikeandNatMontreal
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were there for a weekend at the end of October. The room was clean but you could see it had seen better days. The carpet was kind of.... Since it was our first time in Chicago the concierge suggested a restaurant. It was obvious that the restaurant gave a kickback of somekind since we had to present a ticket given to us by the concierge. The biggest drawback for us was that on our last day we asked for a wake-up and never got it. A good think that my spouse woke up otherwise we would have missed our flight. We told this to the receptionist who didn't to care too much about the situation. "Sorry about that I'll talk to the manager". Also our minibar wasn't restocked and we had to trust the hotel on our consumption since no one was available to check. The situation is nice(very near the Hancock Tower and the Magnificent Mile) and in comparison to the other hotels it appeared human sized. Mike and Nath

Reviews.Title: “Had Great stay at the Talbott!”
Reviews.Author: drmisha80
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived, I was treated like an honored guest. Staff is amazingly friendly without being overbearing--every staffperson gives you their name from the doorman to the concierge. They have a nightly turndown service with chocolates on the pillow. This is a historically renovated hotel that still has amazing modern conveniences--electric buttons for stating when you don't want to be disturbed. They also have many eco friendly choices. Plush robes in the rooms, amazing towels. We used the one conference room for our meeting and it was the perfect size for a group of 20 or so. I slept great and cannot wait to go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: ATXhome
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Talbott for 6 nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. Our room was a "Deluxe Parlor King" which the Web site says is 520 sq ft. The room was HUGE, which made it very comfortable for an extended stay. (Our room appeared to be a handicapped accessible room which makes me wonder if it was even a little larger than that type of room would normally be.) The bathroom was very large also, with a separate tub and shower and Aveda products. The towels were nicer than our towels at home. The place was very clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel was just a couple of blocks from Michigan Avenue so it was close to lots of great shopping, restaurants and sites. The free breakfast was okay if you like to keep it simple in the morning (toast/croissants, yogurt, lunch meats & cheeses, cereal). If you need a little more, there is a great diner nearby (Tempo Cafe), a place across the street and a Starbuck's in the area. Be sure to also hit the fabulous cupcake shop (More) down the street. One thing that we didn't like was the Business Center. This consisted of one computer which you had to pay to use in 15 minute increments and then pay for copies also. It's free to use for printing boarding passes, but I didn't realize that until after I spent $7 to print ours. Next time, I'll just take a laptop. Despite this, we had a wonderful time at this hotel and will stay there next time we visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Jake-Chev
Reviews.Content: We arrived before noon expecting just to leave our bags, but were shown to our room where we were able to relax before heading out. Staff was consistently friendly and solicitous, especially the concierges Tim and Stephanie.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in Chicago city center”
Reviews.Author: MarcMich
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Talbott hotel. And the experience was very positive. Tt was the cheapest hotel in the tripadvisor top 10 for Chicago, yet value was certainly not cheap: nice spacy rooms, huge flat screen TV, large badroom, all very clean. Also you're just a few blocks away from all main streets and from the Hancock tower. A tip when booking: book directly on the website of the Talbott hotel, because then you'll also get free vouchers for breakfast at the hotel - when booking through other internet channels you will not get those vouchers!

Reviews.Title: “Wow - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LongHaulEconomySucks
Reviews.Content: What a great place. The hotel is around the corner from great shops and attractions like the Sears Tower and about five to ten minutes walk to the beach. I stayed in a suite which was wonderful. The most comfortable sofa I have sat on in years. Huge LCD televisions with cable (High Def). A large bathtub with jacuzzi-type jets that massage you when you're lying in it., and a walk in shower. A large, comfortable bed too. I'm just sorry I only stayed for a night. One thing - I booked a standard room a few weeks in advance at a rate of about $300. When I checked their website again nearer the time, I could get a suite for the same price. It's worth checking the day before you arrive as prices seem to change all the time - you might get lucky like me and get a suite for the normal price of a standard

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected, even after reading reviews!”
Reviews.Author: purduesara
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just stayed at the Talbott this past weekend and LOVED it. The hotel was perfect for the night we wanted to spend in the city before visiting family in the suburbs. The location was wonderful. It is just blocks from Michigan Avenue which made our shopping and eating out plans very easy. The hotel is on a nice street with a good restaurant (Feast) across the way. We had breakfast there. The one thing I will say, as we did not plan to have breakfast anywhere but the hotel, is that the complimentary breakfast you get by booking through the hotel Web site is not great. It featured a few cereals and some stale bread and lunch meat. We were disappointed but did not expect too much given that it was free. The wait staff in the morning seemed annoyed with the complimentary breakfast people. That was surprising because the night before we had drinks in the bar and thought the bartender was great. (FYI - Two seven and sevens and two cosmos cost us around $50 with a generous tip) I room was really nice. It was a great size with a comfortable, large bed and a good size bathroom. The hotel is very eco-friendly which is always a plus. The entire staff was very helpful and made our trip great. When we left we wished we could stay another night. With tax we paid about $180 for the night. If the price is similar in the future this will be our hotel choice for all of our visits.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary service at the Talbott, a home away from home in Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: MMD989
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago for a long weekend to celebrate a 20th Wedding Anniversary. The Talbott was the perfect choice to meet all of our needs. We stayed in King Suite and were impressed with the size of the room with a separate bedroom, living room area and extra large bathroom with soaking tub, shower and two vanities. Loved all of the windows and natural light that came into the room, we felt like we were at a home away from home. Hotel was very quiet and floors don't have as many rooms as a large chain hotel. Location was excellent for sightseeing and visiting shops along Michigan Ave. Hotel staff was extraordinary and all from valet, bellman, front desk and concierge staff were very nice and made us feel welcome at all times. Equinox fitness center was very nice, even if it is not in the hotel. We were able to use the healthclub to get a good workout. Also need to mention free WIFi internet access. Book online with hotel and recieve complimentary continental breakfast. Only drawback was the hotel has two small elevators for 16 floors but we never had to wait long. The hotel next door was under construction during our visit but we did not hear any noise as we were on the 10th floor of the hotel. Good proximity to Rush Street, Michigan Ave. We would return to the Talbott for our next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fischro
