Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 3 nights at The Talbott. The room was spacious, comfortable and well-appointed. The hotel is quiet although there is some construction nearby. Linens and towels first-class. Free Wi-Fi in the room. The location is terrific, just one block to Michigan Avenue. We will stay here on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint luxury in the heart of what's happening!”
Reviews.Author: cansaid
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Talbott a number of times, mostly for business and sometimes for pleasure. It is just beautiful, the rooms feel like a luxurious version of home and the staff could not be more pleasant. All that, and you are in walking distance of so much to do in Chicago... the Talbott really has it all!

Reviews.Title: “We love the Talbott!”
Reviews.Author: FConnor
Reviews.Content: We took a family trip with 28, 18 and 15 year old children to Chicago. I found The Talbott on TripAdvisor and wanted to let everyone know we loved it. Small, European style hotel, with lovely lobby area (lots of woodwork) but most impressive was the staff. Everyone went out of their way to make us feel welcome. The rooms were beautful and spotless. Our only issue was a bartender that didn't seem to enjoy her job...but that was minor. The rest of the staff went above and beyond. I would highly recommend The Talbott for singles, couples or families.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarrior789
Reviews.Content: Being in the "road warrior" world one of the last thing I wanted to do was to go stay in another hotel for a week end. But this was a special week end, our 3rd wedding aniversery. My Wife sugguested that we stay at the Talboots for this week end. Boy! what an experiance. From the time I dropped off our "special car" giving the door man strict insturctions on how it was to be treated, to the check in desk, the bell man who showed us all the neat tricks of the room, and the list goes on. My Wife had been in contact with Concierge, Stephanie, and the two of them surprised me with dinner reservations for Friday and Saturday evneing, what my Wife did not know was I surprised her with tickets to the Solhiem Cup on Friday. By the time we got to the hotel our thoughts of about dinner had changed and, Stephanie was in true form got our dinner reservations changed to suit our late arrival times, and advised us that at the Friday night dinner time there was a group of 45 people arriving ahead of us and she sugguested to move our dinner time back to avoid the rush. This was a great idea, and I doubt if anyone else would have sugguested to move dinner to later time as to not upset a guest and tell them that there dinner reservation was not available. During this talk with Stephanie, we where talking about some tours we wanted to do on Saturday. When we returned from a wonderfull dinner, Stephanie had taken the time to look into the tours that we wanted to do and advised us of the available times for Saturday. With this information at hand, we where able to plan our Saturday and still have a time to rest before dinner. Again all I can say is WOW. The Talbott's have a new local customer. See you soon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Talbott”
Reviews.Author: BCCGolfer
Reviews.Content: I don't ever take the time to write a review but the Talbott was so nice it deserves another recommendation. Robert and Andrew greeted us as we walked in and made our stay so pleasant. They bent over backwards to make us happy - even as far as making dinner reservations for us. The concierge was a bit condescending but the rest of the staff more than made up for it. The rooms were large and well appointed and very clean. The beds were amazing. The bathroom had thick towels and robes. Will definitely stay there again - got a great deal from 1800 hotels on short notice. The construction next door was a non-issue as we did not hear a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Find!”
Reviews.Author: babyjack_07
Reviews.Content: My husband, young son and I were visiting family in Milwaukee and decided to take the train to Chicago for a night. I searched the internet at the last minute for a place to stay and came across the Talbott. What a wonderful find! We got to the hotel at 10:30am thinking we would just leave our luggage and go explore till check in, but our room was ready and they kindly let us check in early. We stayed in a deluxe king room, which was very spacious. The room was clean and very well maintained. We couldn't have asked for a better location. Just a few blocks from Michigan Ave. and many stores and restaurants. I hope we get to go back and stay longer next time!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and room”
Reviews.Author: amsmoothey
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us and it lived up to expectations. It is ideally situated in walking distance of many of the sites and is minutes walk from Michigan Ave. The hotel provided brekfast free of charge (we booked online to get this) and the room was spacious and newly decorated. Large plasms TV, free WIFI etc. Even though there is building work next door there was no noise or dust and we sat outside the hotel everyday for breakfast and occasionally for an afternoon drink. The staff are friendly and importantly the hotel is a lot cheaper than the four seasons and other well known hotels just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Talbott Hotel is the best hotel in Chicago with it's intimate size and elegant decor, great location, personable staff!”
Reviews.Author: SydChicago
Reviews.Content: My favorite place to stay in town. Talbott Hotel epitomizes classic Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: LPWtravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed one night at the Talbott. Our stay started out great when we were given a free upgrade to a one bedroom suite. It was fabulous! The living room was large with a couch, two comfy chairs, a flat screen tv and a full-size desk. The bathroom was also quite large with 2 sinks. What a treat to not have to share! We booked on-line, so we received a complimentary continental breakfast. The free breakfast is very limited: juice, cereal, yogurt, cold cuts and muffins. We were able to upgrade to a better breakfast for $5. However, we would not have known about this if we hadn't been eavesdropping on other diners. (Our waiter was not very helpful.) The $5 breakfast was 2 eggs, sausage or bacon and potatoes. This was quite a bargain and it arrived piping hot! Always a plus in my book. The Talbott is in a great location. It is only a few blocks from Michigan Avenue, very close to the Hancock Building and Water Tower Place. Despite all the construction being done outside the hotel, we did not hear any noise. (We were there Friday/Saturday.) I am not sure if the noise would have been worse during the week. Another plus was the free Wi-Fi. I am still amazed that so many high-end hotels charge for this. I would highly recommend the Talbott Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and stay!!”
Reviews.Author: b0cam0m
Reviews.Content: Our family, including two teen girls, stayed at The Talbott for one week recently. We had a one bedroom suite with adjoining king bedroom (two bedroom suite, actually) and found the rooms to be impeccably clean and comfortable. The decor was beautiful and it was a nice retreat after hours of shopping and sightseeing. The Talbott is a very short walk off Michigan Avenue located between State and Rush so we were never far from restaurants, clubs, bars, and, of course, SHOPPING! My husband and I walked along Rush and enjoyed the nightlife during our "dates". The staff at The Talbott were very friendly and helpful. The bellmen and concierge always had a smile and a "can we help you?" attitude. We make an annual trip to the Windy city from South Florida and will definitely consider staying at The Talbott again!!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service & Hotel Getaway”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisTravel4
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Talbot Hotel. We had stayed at several other 4 and 5 star hotels in the city over the years. The Talbot was a pleasant surprise! We had an impeccable room/suite -so clean, roomy, up to date and relaxing! The help was ever so kind-we didn't confront any employee that didn't go out of there way to be friendly, helpful and comforting to each of us. We will definetely return to the Talbot over other over priced 4 and 5 star hotels in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Boutiques”
Reviews.Author: IslandFolks
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week's stay at the Talbott in Chicago. It was truly a great vacation and the Talbott is a cut above the rest. My wife loved the room so much, that for 2 days she just wanted to stay in the room while I had errands during the day. She especially liked the heater on the marble bathroom floors.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location at the Talbott”
Reviews.Author: paratanytarsus
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Talbott which was in easy walking distance of the Hancock Tower, Millenium park, Sears Tower etc. Staff were friendly, and helpful. Menu was varied but limited. Numerous Restaurants nearby, avoid Gibsons as very expensive. We had large comfortable Room with walk in wardrobe, well equipped bathroom with his and hers toilet rolls and basins. Not cheap, but central and not as expensive as the Water Tower next door.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Jaunt
Reviews.Content: As you enter through the scaffolding, you immediately sense an old world elegant feel to the hotel. We had booked a double queen room and were pleasantly surprised by the spacious room. (I think it was twice the size of the room at the nearby W which I will not visit again). The beds were very comfortable and the room decorations were luxurious. I enjoyed the Aveda bathroom products. There were comfortable robes for 2. Booking online got us complimentary buffet breakfast for 2. The buffet was very nice and we sat outside on a beautiful morning. It will be nicer when the construction next door is finished. The concierge was very helpful for dinner and recommended a local hotspot where he booked us a table that same night. That restaurant was packed with a long wait (over an hour), but we weren't that hungry so we waited at the bar. I didn't expect much since we had only just made the reservations. We were pleasantly surprised when not more than 10 minutes had passed and we were seated. the host said that they like the concierge at the Talbott and were accommodating us since we were staying there. Free internet for 24 hours came with the room too. We also took advantage of the passes for the local Equinox. No hotel gym can compare to a full service gym like Equinox. We had great workouts!

Reviews.Title: “The best in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: VikingVagabond
Reviews.Content: The Talbott must be the best, most convenient and comfortable hotel in Chicago! We had a kingsize room, with a huge bed with enough room for a bunch of people... The hotel style is "European" in an American way, which means dark colours and tartans. Not very stylish, but tres burgeois! The service was mediate, front desk could take advantage of more smiling, and snob down a little... The hotel is extremely well located, just off the Michigan Avenue with all the stylish shops and great reataurant. I would chose this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable and warm stay”
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a trip to Chicago to celebrate our 30th birthdays and had heard great things about The Talbott, and were able to get a decent rate on a single room suite. Arriving at the hotel we were greeted by the doorman with the biggest smile that never went away during our entire stay. We actually arrived around 9am and they were able to get us into our suite without issue which was a huge plus. They also surprised us with complimentary daily breakfasts because we reserved our room through their site. The hotel its self is bit older but has been well maintained, and still has the warm feeling that you really donâ€™t get from newer more â€œmodernâ€� places. The room was outstanding with a huge living space, what seemed like an even larger bathroom, and a great bedroom. The king bed was one of the best that I have ever slept on; my wife had the same thought. The bathroom which is covered in marble had a separate room for the toilet, a large bathtub, a large glass shower and three sinks. Two of them are together while the other is on the opposite side of the bathroom which is quite nice if there are two people getting ready at the same time. The location is optimal and basically walking distance from everything. Its a few blocks from the Magnificent Mile, few blocks from the Hancock building, and a decent walk to the Navy Pier. The street itâ€™s on gets a bit crowed as they are doing construction next door (which we never heard), but as long as you cross with the lights, youâ€™ll be fine. I definitely recommend giving The Talbott a try if you want a nice warm, almost like home feeling, while still right in the heart of all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: lpowell
Reviews.Content: I'd long heard about how wonderful the Talbott was, and was really looking forward to my visit. It far surpassed my expectations. The service was first-class from the moment we arrived until we checked out, the hotel is quite elegant in a very comfortabe way, and the location couldn't be better. Would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Talbot!”
Reviews.Author: Aralynn
Reviews.Content: What a special place!! Not only is the location ideal, but the outstanding service from the Front Desk insured a wonderful stay for us. Both Sarah and Naomi went out of their way to accommodate my requests to be both away from the construction next door and in a spacious room. Our room was FABULOUS and I can not wait to return to our new favorite place to stay in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel, staff and rate”
Reviews.Author: MarylandTeacups
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled with my in-laws. They are in their late 80's we are 51. We were all pleased

Reviews.Title: “luxurious, convenient, perfect for a city break”
Reviews.Author: BryanBerry
Reviews.Content: The reviews were accurate. I arrieved a little early so it took a while to get a room but for the inconvenience, I was upgraded to a one bedroom suite. If I wanted to live in downtown Chicago, I would love for my place to be the hotel suite I was in. it was perfect. Huge beautiful bathroom and separate bedroom. I only wished I stayed there for more than one night. The location is excellent. a block from Michigan avenue and close to lots of shopping, dining and nightlife but also very safe neighborhood. Most of the staff was extremely pleasant from the doormen to the bellman to the front desk. I really enjoyed my stay here. Also, very comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Hawk34
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights at the Talbott in early June. This first stay at this hotel was everything we wanted for a getaway to the city. Our king room was spacious, quiet, and very comfortable. The bath towels were especially nice.The hotel staff was friendly and helpful, yet relaxed. We received excellent service from everyone who helped us. We enjoyed a nice breakfast in the restaurant on two mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: GreatGetaway1
Reviews.Content: The Talbott provided an exceptional experience while I stayed in Chicago last March. The size of the room was more than comfortable, I was taken a back by how large a room it was given we were in such a large inner city location. The staff was more than accommodating on every request. The interior pulled you in like a cozy bed and breakfast in the country with warm tones and fireplaces, you forgot you were just steps away from all the excitement of the city. If your looking for that special experience, do yourself a favor and book a room at the Talbott!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Corn44
Reviews.Content: Beautiful large guestrooms and suites, excellent service, to-die-for linens...overall one of the best hotel experiences for a group of seasoned travelers.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: ouverte
Reviews.Content: We come to Chicago once a year for a romantic get away. The Talbott is our favorite hotel so far. You get the same amenities as "bigger names", but with a price that is very reasonable and a cozier atmosphere. Location is great, staff helpful and friendly. I personally love a smaller hotel that is quaint and high quality. Highly recommend for those looking for the same.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would recommend to all my friends & family!”
Reviews.Author: GymratParkland_FL
Reviews.Content: My husband & I travel from Ft Laud to Chi-town once a year and this is our 2nd year staying at the Talbott and look forward to coming back next year. Great location close to Michigan Ave & Rush St, and daily passes to the Equinox gym in the Bloomingdales building. We always excercise when traveling therefore a gym is important to us. Hugos Frog Bar on Rush St was a great place for seafood, we even ran into the general mgr for the Chicago Bears. You won't be disappointed staying at The Talbott!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: keldozer
Reviews.Content: I don't think I could even think of something to complain about.. Food was excellent, the rooms were clean and beautiful, and the location was great. The service was exceptional, friendly, and helpful beyond expectations helping us with directions around the city, transportation, and anything else we needed.. The only thing that was kind of an eyesore more than anything was the construction on the building next door to the hotel, though we couldn't hear or see it from our room, and there was construction all over the city while we were there. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definetly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Boutique”
Reviews.Author: Airotciv
Reviews.Content: Very quaint and romantic, yet masculine. I've noticed that at most Chicago hotel bars it's hard to get a drink much less a seat but I guess because it's a small hotel that was not a problem at the Talbott - plus people take their drinks out to the seating in the lobby because it's so inviting - cozy and comfortable - love that! Would love to stay again but I must say that I was surprised by all the comments on the comfortable beds - ours was too firm. Also note there is no gym on the premises - but walking and shopping is enough of a workout!

Reviews.Title: “Check the door locks!!!!”
Reviews.Author: roryholly
Reviews.Content: There are plenty of great things to say about the Talbott: it's location is brilliant for shopping, restaurants, bars and just about everything the great city of Chicago has to offer. The hotel is beautiful, the lobby is elegant and the rooms are tastefully decorated. We managed to get a great offer via the internet and we chose a corner executive room. However, we did get the 'internet' room which had construction right outside the window! The first downside to this beautiful place is that the cleaners left our room door unlocked when they were finished cleaning. We were certainly surprised when we tried to put the key in and the door swung open. The other downside is that the room service is minimal. We ordered dinner and received a beautifully set up tray with flowers, 2 glasses of water and 2 bowls of pasta and absolutely nothing else. The pasta had been put in the microwave and served in the same bowl, there was no bread, no garnish absolutely nothing. Fo the prices they charged I expected more. The breakfast, which wasn't included in the internet pricing, was very good. I would recommend this hotel for a nice shopping weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, nice location, and very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Suburbaniteswithbaby
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a trip to Chicago, and agree with other reviewers that this hotel is a gem. It has a great location (2 blocks from magnificent mile, and 1.5 mile walk to the original Marshall Field's). The staff was very friendly, and accomodations had an old-Chicago flair. I believe the building next door is under construction, but it was not that loud, and you could only hear the workers during business hours (maybe this was the reason for the great price? It did not disturb our stay). Parking was not included (I don't stay in big cities often, so I'm not sure if that is normal). I would also recommend trying to book though the hotel - it was SIGNIFICANTLY cheaper than any of the travel searches, like Orbitz. It had a 40"+ Aquas tv, available mini fridge on request, and nice elavators (some of the other elavators in town made my life flash before my eyes...).

Reviews.Title: “Like a Bed and Breakfast Intimate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nelle1979
Reviews.Content: I was first at the Talbott about 10 years ago and was pleasantly surprised by the small warm interior surroundings. I was walking into a private livingroom where you feel like opening up a book and curling up in forot of the fire. A quaint little bar/restaurant with as well. The service is not outstanding however they are always polite. Perhaps I simply wish people to WOW me.! The bathrooms ( which I had - cannot say they are all like this in every room) could be updated as they are not in line with the sumptious bedroom allure. I would recommend a night stay at the Talbott.

Reviews.Title: “Makes one feel that one is to the Manor born”
Reviews.Author: Adlai
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the lobby you feel like you have stepped into an English men's club. Cosy, charming, and elegant, this hotel makes you feel that you are a guest in someone's home. I stayed in the King deluxe room which was very spacious. The bed featured a pillow top mattress and this was the first time that I have ever noticed the bedding in a hotel stay. The bathroom features both a shower and a soaking tub which I took ample use of. The mini bar was the most upscale one that I have seen with Voss water, exceptional wine, and gourmet cookies along with the usual array of soft drinks, beers etc. It was room service all the way for me. I recommend the Lasagna Emiliana and the chocolate gelatto for dinner along with the bottle of wine from the mini bar and the Banana-stuffed Brioche French Toast with Mascarpone, Hazelnuts and syrup for Breakfast. If you don't feel like staying in, the hotel is well located and I would think about dining at Le Colonial or Pierrot Gourmet just blocks away. I admit, I stayed here last December and had an issue with the hotel, but because they followed up so professionally and promptly, I decided to stay here again when I chose to stay here rather than a night at Northwestern hospital.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, restaurant, and staff!”
Reviews.Author: VacationerSeattle
Reviews.Content: Be careful if you stay in rooms ending in 07 or 08, early construction starts on that side of the building....very loud and annoying. Other than that it was an excellent place to stay. Nice small lobby with fireplaces where you can sit and have a drink. Cabs pull up right in front of hotel. We loved it. We were there on a college visit so got a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexasGetaway
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Talbot for two nights. Loved everything about the hotel. The staff was wonderful, helpful and extremely friendly. The room was elegant, spacious,clean and quiet. Location was great as we walked everywhere. We didn't eat at the restaurant as there are so many other choices (just ask the concierge!). Only negative was spending 48 dollars a day for parking...but I guess that comes with being in the city. We would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing hotel - will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: frdm2004
Reviews.Content: Just spent a long weekend at the Talbott. We booked via the small luxury hotel website and received a free room upgrade. The room was very spacious for a Chicago hotel. The doorman was just excellent and had good suggestions for us. The hotel is nicely located, just a couple of blocks from the Hancock Center. Wonderful stay, will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel With A Friendly And Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Keven30312
Reviews.Content: The rooms were spacious which surprised me based on previous stays at other hotelss in Chicago. The rate was less than I've paid in other hotels in this city. I loved the High Definition Television in the room. Technical support helped me get logged in to the high speed internet connections within a couple of minutes. The staff was very helpful with directions and recommendations for dining. They helped me print out a boarding pass in the business center at no charge. The Bell Hop ran down a cabbie for me several times and helped with fare information. I will be strongly recommending this hotel for business colleagues, friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Always_on_holidays
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Talbott for over a week and enjoyed our stay. Room was a little noisy as we were next to the lift, but everything else made up for that. Positives: Bed was very comfortable, great to have real shower, free internet, gym usage, staff (all friendly) and location. Negative: Lift noise, lifts slow and restaurant (there are so many great restaurants around - don't bother staying in) Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: reads4kix
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay -- staff was more than accomodating from the moment we arrived. Provided superior service. We live in the western burbs and stayed an evening in Chicago before heading out of town on vacation. Did so to have easy access to public transportaiton on Thanksgiving Day. Bed was extremely comfortable, pillow and linens were great. Will definite consider again next year when we travel out of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Talbott”
Reviews.Author: PegJohnston
Reviews.Content: The location, the room, the staff all outstanding. don't eat there, and don't waste money on a drink....that's the only thing that was not so great. But there are so many great places right around The Talbott, it's the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Talbott”
Reviews.Author: WestcoastguyYVR
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd or 4th stay at the Talbott. I really do love this hotel. The location is only 3 blocks from the Chicago/State red line stop. 2 blocks from Michigan Ave and the Hancock tower. Over the last 2 years since I started staying at the Talbott when in Chicago, I feel the value for the dollar isn't as good as it was. But this is understandable. It is a great hotel, so is on par with other hotels charging similar rates. You used to get passes to the Fitness Formula Club (gold coast location) a short few blocks away, but now they give you passes to the Equinox club which is actually closer on Michigan Ave. However, the Fitness Formula Club was way better. It was much bigger and had a huge selection of equipment. So this is disappointing. Free internet is very reliable. Never once had any problem. Next time I'm in Chicago, even though I love the Talbott, I think I might try something else since the same money can buy other hotels rated just as high on trip advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, intimate hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jsirks
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently enjoyed a couple of days in Chicago to see a play and fully enjoyed our experience at the Talbott. Initially, I was worried about the service due to the concierge's inability to return my e-mails in reference to ordering flowers for my wife, but after a call to the hotel, the concierge was more than helpful and the arrangement ordered was absolutely perfect. The lobby is small (or intimate as you prefer), so if you like to feel anonymous as you enter or leave, this is not the hotel for you. Doormen, bellmen, and receptionists WILL be attending to your needs or wishing you well with big smiles. Being an older hotel, sometimes there is a wait for an elevator (they're slow and small), but not overly so. The rooms were spacious and clean, and the bathroom in our suite was huge and absolutely gorgeous (we'll be remodeling ours soon). My wife visited Lush and the Body Shop for supplies and took no less then three baths during our stay. Our bed was absolutely comfortable. I would agree with others that there is quite a bit of construction in the area (like right next door!), but in reality, we hardly noticed it. If you hear a hammer, turn on the Ipod ready radio or the 42" widescreen TV. It IS the city, after all. The location is wonderful! Only a couple minute stroll to Water Tower Place and an $8.00 cab ride to the Oriental Theater. On the whole, our stay was wonderful and an absolute bargain compared with other hotels in the area. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: 35Argyll
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night city break in Chicago. Booking at last minute caused us problems finding a vacant hotel. The Talbott itself only offered an expensive rate for a suite (last room available). We tracked down a MUCH cheaper rate on activehotels.com for a regular room. On arriving at the Talbott, we were upgraded to the one-bedroom suite! As all comments have mentioned, there is a LOT of building work going on immediately adjacent to the hotel. However, as we were jetlag wise, 5 hours ahead of Chicago time, we were out of the hotel by 0800 and didn't return till late, so heard no noise at all. The suite was comfortable and spacious, with free wifi. Bathroom had 2 large sinks - plenty of room for my husband and myself to spread out. The bed was EXTREMELY comfortable, and we are both very fussy in this respect. Location was excellent - as the weather was sunny, we pretty much walked everywhere. The concierge (both Stephanie and Tim) were very knowledgeable and helpful, coming up with good recommendations for steakhouses that would not be packed with convention goers and fellow tourists. All the staff were friendly and welcoming - we enjoyed our stay, and would readily return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: VolpeTravels
Reviews.Content: I generally stay at the Omni in Chicago but they were booked so I found this hotel for a great deal on orbitz ($199 per night) and booked it. It was great. The location is Ideal. Walk right onto Rush street and enjoy some of the best food in town. The decor in the hotel is very nice and the beds very comfy. I found the room to be very clean and the staff helpfull. I think this will be my first choice in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Love the talbot”
Reviews.Author: rose38
Reviews.Content: The talbot was great. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. The room was updated. The street that the Talbot is on is great, it is a side street that is tree lined. There is a Starbucks right across the street. The bar/restaurant in the hotel is really nice too. It is small but a nice cozy place to get a cocktail. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great visit to the city!”
Reviews.Author: tinshee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights while visiting Chicago as tourists. What a beautiful hotel! Our room was lovely, the staff was super helpful and the location was convenient. They don't have an in house gym, but each day you can get a day pass to a cushy gym down the street. The restaurant in the hotel has a very yummy breakfast. The concierge helped us to make dinner reservations at the last minute our first night there. We were able to walk down the Magnificent Mile from our hotel, as well as through the Gold Coast and Old Towne neighborhoods. There are tons of great restaurants in the area (including the famous Gibsons and the Signature Room in the Hancock tower) as well as lots of shopping. There is currently a lot of construction going on near the Talbott (they are building condos right behind it), but regardless we had a wonderful stay and would definitely stay there again when visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but”
Reviews.Author: Motnam
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at the Talbott. The hotel is good, the staff were very pleasant and helpful, the room was spacious, clean and comfortable and the bed was fantastic. I will stay there again once downtown Chicago has been rebuilt, as this is what seems to be going on right now. The noise from the construction in the vicinity was intrusive and off-putting and it looks like they have a long way to go. I will be back to the Talbott for sure, but not soon. And it's certainly not a reflection on the hotel itself or the staff, simply the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel, but not the restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: IndianaNana
Reviews.Content: The Talbott Hotel in Chicago is my very favorite hotel in the City. The hotel is a small European style hotel with beautiful rooms and an excellent staff. The only thing that wasn't up to pare is the restaurant, and the quality has declined a lot since the last time I stayed at the Talbott. The fruit on the fruit plate was overripe, the yogurt was sour, the coffee was just lukewarm and the breakfast assortment of breads was stale. The service in the restaurant was also poor. The restaurant has a beautiful outside dining area and would be wonderful if the food and service was better. After eating breakfast there we decided to find someplace else for dinner. Hopefully they will improve on this but if not, I'll still stay at the Talbott but find someplace else to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant position, great staff and lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: aboxall
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in the Talbott during our summer vacation. The hotel is well situated for sighseeing, shopping (on the magnificant mile) and good restaurants. The hotel has a great atmosphere and lots of character. Our room was massive and extremely comfortable. The staff were very helpful and accommodating. The only slight negative was the building work that is going on next door, the work is however restricted to set hours (8-5) and the sound insulation is good so this didn't really bother us. We got a very good rate on the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - horrible location”
Reviews.Author: ladiva52
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel and the people were great but I would not stay there again until the construction around it is finished. The elevator in the alley attached to the hotel starts as early as 5:30am and goes into the night - including weekends. Use of the dumpsters (filling and emptying) is constant. Worst of all, to me, is having a restaurant with a sidewalk cafe right next to a construction site with rats running around - truly disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but the best!”
Reviews.Author: jedhawk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent one night at the Talbott Hotel, and loved it. Upon Arrival, we were greeted by two hotel staff prior to reaching the front desk. The girl at the desk was both professional, and courteous; acknowledging our special occasion and giving us a complementary upgrade to a suite was such a nice touch. Because we booked through AAA, we got a great deal on the room rate as it was, including strawberries, wine, and breakfast for two. We had also chosen the Talbott for its close proximity to Chicago's famous steakhouse Gibson's (less than a 10 min walk). Note: make dinner reservations in advance, or see the hotel concierge. On a funnier note: Gibson's is located in the heart of the Viagra Triangle: Google Viagra Triangle for more info. The suite was spacious and "very clean." The living room area had a a 42" flat screen TV, and there was a 27" flat screen in the bedroom. The bathroom (spotless) had both a shower and a large tub that could seat two. The bedroom was comfy, with a nice king size bed. The only drawback to the whole occasion, was the $48 dollar overnight parking fee.... we had thought it was going to be $20, but hey, it's Chicago, and everything is more expensive these days.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant - couldn't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: LoriBar
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through the SLH (Small Luxury Hotel Group). Having stayed in their hotels before and were impressed, we thought we would do the same for our trip to Chicago. A fantastic location for everything, from eating and drinking out to shopping and getting tours. It's located on Delaware Place, which is near the famous eating area on Rush Street. Less than 5 minutes walk away. The room was spacious and has a very good ensuite. The bed was very comfortable and very clean. The towels were changed twice a day if needed. It had a good TV if needed also. It was quiet and although our room was near some building work next door, we rarely heard anything at all. We were located on the 8th floor overlooking the front. The Concierge made our stay worth while in every way. He was friendly, informative and very approachable and willing to help and advise. He is worth his weight in gold. Although all the staff were friendly and helpful, I was say the Concierge, Gene, was the star member of staff. We ate at some very, very good restaurants - our favourite being the Le Colonial, on Rush Street. A French/Vietnamese style restaurant. Our second favourite in the same area was Gibsons. What a great place for a fantasic choice of steaks. Hugo's next door for seafood was also outstanding. There's a restaurant called Japanais, which had brilliant reviews, but we ran out of time to go there - next time! Gene booked us to see the Jersey Boys at the Theatre. Although the tickets were a bit pricey, the show was outstanding and worth every penny. I learnt a lot about Frankie Valli and the Four Seasons and thoroughly enjoyed the music and their performance on the everning. I would go again! We had a fabulous week in Chicago and we will definately return again and stay at the Talbott. Thank you to everyone who made our stay a delight. Coley Hampshire, England

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great service”
Reviews.Author: bobbi222
Reviews.Content: This is a great find for downtown Chicago. The price is right and the staff are excellent. As noted, there is construction going on around the hotel, but I didn't notice any issues that disturbed sleeping. I asked for a quiet room on an upper floor, and was gladly given one. The lobby is small, the atmosphere is that of a small boutique hotel. The concierge, Stephanie did a super job in finding us a restaurant and booking us reservations (along with a complimentary appetizer). We had a standard room, and it was spacious, tastefully decorated--everything we needed. The bathroom had a nice whirlpool tub for soaking--and the MP3 compatible radio was a nice perk. Just can't say enough about how nice the staff are--every single person you meet. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Hopwoodc
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel in a fantastic location. I stayed one night in June 08 and was upgraded to a suite as the hotel was fully booked! The suite was beautifully decorated and well equipped. My stay was trouble free and the staff were friendly and knowledgeable. Would recommend to both the business and holiday traveller.

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel experience ever.”
Reviews.Author: allnall
Reviews.Content: I recently decided on a trip to Chicago. Previously I had stayed at the Le Meridien (now the site of the Conrad Hotel) and was debating a return stay at that facility since my previous exeperience was great. I did some research and decided to try and stay at a different hotel. Using tripadvisor as my main source, in addition to Orbitz and Expedia, I kept noticing that The Talbott Hotel came up as a favorite spot, so with some trepidation (I will admit) I booked my 4 nite stay there. Arriving at the hotel, for me the first thing I noticed was the small lobby area....having stayed mostly at Hilton, Hyatt and other business-type hotels, I was used to larger lobbies, and multiple desk attendants, but I absorbed the experience and checked in. I was upgraded due to the fact that I had reserved my room thru the slh.com website (Small Luxury hotels), of which The Talbott was a member. That website encourages the person to create a list of their pet likes, pillow types, food, etc...and I created a list of things I enjoyed. The room, was spacious, wonderfully appointed, comfortable and met all of my needs. A few minutes after I had started to uppack my luggage, the door bell rang, and a waiter appeared, carrying a large bowl of fruits and other items, I was surprised as I had not ordered anything. When I opened the letter, it was a typed welcome letter, indicating that enclosed were a few items I had indicated I liked (chocolates, bottled water, etc....) and that anything I need I was to contact the desk. What a wonderful way to be welcomed, I thought. I had a few things I wanted to do while in Chicago, and so I went downstairs to the Concierge and met Stephanie. Now any of you who have read back reviews from folk who have stayed at The Talbott will recall that many people praised Stephanie as a wonderful host, and Concierge. Well, I cannot say enough about her. I spent the better part of 40 minutes chatting with her about what kind of restaurants i wanted to try (it was my birthday) and other things i wanted to do. She took notes, went online and showed me different restaurants that she could recommend, called them up to make reservations as I was sitting there, and mae a couple reservations at those that the times were amenable to me. I ate at the RL restaurant (yes, Ralph Lauren), and was personally greeted when I walked in. I asked them how did you know my name, and they replied that Stephanie had called them to let them know I was coming over. I was overwhelmed...I had never experienced such special attention at any other hotel. They comped me on my desert, since Stephanie had told them it was my birthday, and all in all, I had a wonderful time. I told her that i wanted to go see a Jazz or Blues show and she pointed me to the Backroom, a few blocks away from the hotel. She looked in her draw and found me a ticket for free entrance to the show (normally $20 at the door). The concert was great, and I was there for nearly 3 hrs, drinking and enjoying the music. The place is small, intimate, but the sound is great, so it is a good place to enjoy a show. Everyone at The Talbott was gracious, smiling and helpful. I felt like I was staying with family....I cannot explain it any other way. Every morning I would come down and chat with Stephanie for a few minutes about what I was doing that day, and she suggested other things that i might do also. It was like a well-choreographed show!!! The location is perfect, near to Rush Street and the bars, restaurants and stores, Michigan Avenue is about a block and a 1/2 away.....there are buses, free trolleys so there is no problem to get where you want to go. In my stay in Chicago I had purchased a few items that could not be packed in my carry-on, and so i asked Stephanie if the Hotel could arrange for the stuff to be sent via UPS to my home. No problem, she said. I gave them my address etc....and all was arranged. I received the items aboout 4 days later. I really was sorry to leave. It was such a wonderful experience. Time and time again while I was sitting with Stephanie other folk would come in and thank her for reservations she had made for them, recommendations for theatre, restaurants, walking tours, etc....and would turn to me while I was sitting there and tell me that they always come back to The Talbott because of her. Some brought in small gifts of their appreciation....I have never seen this at any other hotel I have stayed at. I have to say that I did initially have some trepidation when i booked this hotel. I was not familiar with smaller, boutique-styled hotels, but I was sooo pleasantly surprised that I would feel as if I betrayed them if I were to ever re-visit Chicago and not stay at The Talbott. My trip was that special. That, I can safely say, is the kind of experience that makes it very easy to return time and time again to a hotel. I can safely recommend The Talbott to anyone who is looking for a different type of hotel stay....one that does not revolve around a large, Business-type place (Hilton, Hyatt etc...not that I am knocking them). I cannot wait to return to the Talbott, I was that moved by my time there.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel, fabulous location, excellent service staff, large rooms,”
Reviews.Author: triptots
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the Talbott very much. Larger than average room and bathroom, comfortable bed, service staff well trained without being "snooty." Fabulous location on Delaware, two blocks from Michigan Ave. The downstairs Bice Bistro was superb for every course, morning through late night and there is a Starbucks directly across the street. A small hotel with great charm. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: BrizoSeattle
Reviews.Content: We were booked at the Talbott via Hotwire at a very good rate. We had some concerns after reading the reviews on tripadvisor, particularly about the construction noise. First, let me say the staff is outstanding, the rooms are beautiful and we would not hesitate staying there again. Stephanie, the concierge, is very, very good and made a huge impact on our stay. The hotel is relatively small but very, very upscale. Second, we found no more noise at the hotel than any other big city establishment. We were on the 11th floor and the construction was much higher and was not objectionable. Third, the location was perfect for us as we could walk to all the sights and restaurants. All the restauants on Rush St. are about a 3 block walk. Stephanie got us reservations at two marvelous spots. The Hancock Tower, where we enjoyed late night drinks, is also about a 3 block walk. The ONLY negative is you have to call room service to get ice. This is one nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but too much construction noise.”
Reviews.Author: TAIC-LA
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel overall, with probably the best service that I've ever experienced. The huge drawback, however, is the construction that is occurring on both sides of the hotel. They generally work 8am - 8pm Mon-Sat (we stayed for a week) and one of the buildings had workers present on Sunday as well. This was not disclosed on any part of the website at the time of booking. This hotel will be perfect when the construction's done, though the doorman at the hotel when we left estimated that they'd be working for another 1-2 years.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location--when the construction in the area is complete”
Reviews.Author: jah5
Reviews.Content: I booked the Talbott Hotel for a two night stay in Chicago. I chose it because they offered the best rates for a 4 star hotel in the location I was looking for (convenient to shopping and dining). The positives: a nice staff, large rooms, clean and well maintained. The negatives: major construction taking place immediately next door to the hotel--sleeping past 7 a.m. was not possible and needless to say, my three teens did not like this at all. When I booked my reservation, I had inquired about construction noise and was told that it was not a factor anymore and that they had not received any comments/complaints from guests about the noise. I would not hesitate to stay here when construction is complete. It's not hip, fancy or luxurious, but charming and well-located at a price that represents a fair value--when the construction is complete.

Reviews.Title: “Second time Around”
Reviews.Author: TimeTraveler123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Talbott in February. I wrote a review but it wasn't listed. I wonder why? Fine hotel but there is construction next door that runs 6 days a week - 8am-8pm, with noisy consturciton elevators running 12 hours a day and bright lights on 24/7. Avoid until the construction is over. Then, it will be a very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel38
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 3 night stay at the Talbott hotel in Chicago. We had booked this through Hotwire so we didn't know we were staying here until after we had purchased through Hotwire. This was a great place to stay! I knew we had one of the smaller rooms - which was a Deluxe King room. But, once we walked into our room we saw that it was very spacious for a regular room. Very nice and updated decor, and everything was extremely clean. The first 2 nights we hardly saw any other guests in the hotel. Seemed like we had the place to ourselves which was a nice relief from the busy Chicago streets. I read others' complaints about the noise of construction next to the hotel which made me nervous since I'm a light sleeper. While we did see the construction, I never heard any of it - and we slept in most mornings until 9:30 or so. I read that the suites in the hotel had jacuzzi tubs, and I knew we didn't have one in ours as we had a regular room. However, the tub was very deep and great for soaking! (Might I add, this was the cleanest hotel tub I've seen in a long time!) We had a wonderful time staying here and the staff was wonderful and friendly. My husband did have one complaint - though the bed was comfortable, the down comforter on the bed wasn't long enough to cover his feet. His not extremely tall, about 6'0. So, that made sleeping a bit rougher on him, but overall we loved our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not Sure Why It's So Highly Rated”
Reviews.Author: ecortez01
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Talbott in March, and I honestly don't understand what the attraction is. The staff was great--extremely friendly and accommodating. However, the rooms are small and nondescript, and the neighborhood is a construction zone, so it was incredibly noisy. I wouldn't recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DowntownMom
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Talbott for a long weekend visiting family in Chicago. While the dark, psuedo English decor is not my taste, we found the hotel to be a great choice at a fair price. We loved the location and could walk to the Hancock tower, Michigan Avenue etc. Navy Pier was a $10 cab ride. The staff at the hotel are amazing. They helped get reservations that were impossible to get. They took packages. They delivered extra beds immediately. The hotel is connected to the restaurant BICE so the room service was great if priced for that type of high end restaurant. Breakfast was also delivered in 20 minutes which is unusual these days. The room was large. The bathroom had a tub and a stand alone shower. More importantly, it had Aveda products. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: swmarket
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Talbott twice in the last few weeks. I was very pleased with every facet of my stays. The staff, from doormen to front desk, to concierge, to housekeeping, were wonderful. The rooms were nicely sized and clean, and well stocked. I will return to the Talbott anytime!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotel Staffs you'll find in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: NY_Transplaned_to_FL
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on several websites I decided to book a room at the Talbott during one of the coldest times of the year. It was well worth it! From the second we arrived it was clear that the entire staff was hand picked and thoroughly trained to be warm and friendly. From the bellman to front desk to the maintenance man in the elevator....they all took time to say good morning and have a great day. That type of service is no accident. This place really was more than I expected for the price. Our suite was large and comfortable. The bathroom had a separate shower and the bath accessories were top notch. The hotel offers free morning coffee in the lobby but there is also a Starbucks right around the corner and everything worth seeing along the Mag Mile is within a short walk. I would stay there again. This is my first review submitted to Trip Advisor and I am doing this almost a year after my stay. I felt obligated to give credit where credit is due! This hotel felt more like a 5 star hotel than several of the 5 star hotels I have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “The Talbott is lovely”
Reviews.Author: MissFiona
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely small hotel in a great location. The staff is exceptionally gracious and helpful. The little restaurant-bar (Bice's) is exquisite, and its cocktails, wines, food, and service are excellent. The dark wood paneling throughout the common areas is warm and cozy. The theme of fox-hunting in the artwork is unfortunate, though, for those (like me) who find this "sport" barbaric.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: cynbyn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights, we were upgraded upon arrival to the executive suites. The room was huge if a little dark, howver the huge comfy bed and aveda products made up for it. Perfect location however found room service to be very pricey.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: smk007
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Talbott a few times and had always liked it. This time was my first visit in 2 years and I was disappointed. The hallways are now looking tired and the carpets need to be replaced. I had asked for a corner room but instead was given a small and very dark room looking out onto a wall 10 feet away with multiple noisy vents immediately outside the window. The lights had to be kept on throughout the day even through the days were bright. The bathroom was tiny and would be difficult to manage with 2 people in the room. The AC unit rumbled on permanently with background white noise even when switched off. Having stayed there before I know there are better rooms but this one was the same price as the others I have been in and the risk is getting it again. Other small things contributed - the lobby brownies are no longer, there were no cup lids for the lobby coffee (so you couldn't walk out with the coffee) and I got a newspaper only on the last morning of a 5-night stay. The construction noise was not too bad but does start at 7.30am and goes on until around 8pm, including weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and plush and wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: thinktankjp
Reviews.Content: I booked last minute at the Talbott while in Chicago, and was very happy with my stay and services. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially the concierge with directions and recommendations. I stayed in a double queen-bed room, which was huge by traditional hotel room standards. The carpet was plush, the bed comfortable, and the other amenities quite thoughtful (such as umbrellas in the room just in case). Aveda bath products were also a nice touch. One caution: there is a large construction site next to the hotel, so rooms facing that side will be noisy after 8:00 a.m. most mornings. The front desk staff was accommodating though and offered to move me if the noise was too much. I would highly recommend this hotel, and definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bookitnow
Reviews.Content: Chicago is one of our favorite cities to visit. Some friends suggested trying The Talbott. I'm delighted we took them up. The Talbott is a great "small" hotel a block and a half off of Michigan Avenue near the Four Seasons, Drake and Westin. The concierge staff was most helpfull. Gene and Stephanie took great care of us. The rooms were spacious and very fresh. The elevators could be a bit slow at times. Aside from the construction next door, our stay was perfect. Bice now runs the hotel restaurant. We enjoyed having breakfast there. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Supurb Boutique Hotel, AWESOME location, authentic connected service”
Reviews.Author: desertflowerpower
Reviews.Content: OK, I love visiting the most friendly, clean, delightful city in the world, Chicago. I am hooked on this gem of a city, I wish my business would transfer me here, but if they did THEN I couldn't just visit this wonderful hotel smack in the center of the action, like coming home, delightful. Just a snidge off the main beam of Michigan Ave. wonderfulness, so the location is quiet yet steps to everything. From the doormen (thank you Charles and Perry) to the concierge (many thanks to Gene and Stephanie) to the front desk to the housekeeping staff, everyone is genuinely caring about the guest. I am over the top for this hotel and would give it a TripAdvisor #10 if the rating was available. The rates are in synch with the area, even if a bit high (sigh), well, whataya gonna do? The rooms are lovely, the amenities deep, the beds firm, the service top notch. This should be your choice. I have my cheerleader pom poms out for the Talbott. Woohoooo!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: TripperBangor
Reviews.Content: Although The Talbott may seem expensive it gives full value and is in a very good location. Our Deluxe Corner King room was spacious and excellent quality and the hotel and its staff are very welcoming, efficient and friendly. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, beautiful hotel in heart of Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: chloestella7
Reviews.Content: The reservationists are rude on the phone but when I arrived at the hotel the staff was very accommodating and friendly. My room was HUGE and absolutely beautiful. The hotel is located in a very convenient location where every restaurant and sights are from walking distance. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “The Talbott is great!!!”
Reviews.Author: fayce2b
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed 4 nights at the Talbott returning home on Saturday 9/29. We all had a wonderful time and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. The staff from top to bottom were excellent, accommodating. The room was roomy...with our only complaint being not being able to cool the room fast enough after a day on the town. The construction next door was obstructing the sidewalk, but being on a oneway street limited that difficulty. The doorman, Andrew was an excellent source at this hotel. He arranged all our transportation at night to restaurants. We enjoyed everything about the hotel and the city. The hotel was expensive but met expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, service not always”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamSquirrel
Reviews.Content: The rooms in the Talbott are good, large and recently refurbished. The WiFi internet is good and free of charge. The staff is not always as friendly as they should be, but overall this stay was nice. The location is great, just of Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Travel_1975
Reviews.Content: I can easily say this is one of the worst hotels I've stayed at the. The receptionist up front was a snooty, sarcastic teenager or post teenager. You can get better service from a waiter or waitress at a diner. The room was dirty, stains on the carpet, the showerhead was moldy and rusted, the doors of the bathroom and main door all had dents and scratches. The towels had a horrible aroma. The hotel is very narrow, so we were near a construction zone so, I would plan on waking up at 6:am if you choose the Talbott. The next day, I asked for another room and the concierge who was a decent guy moved us to a larger more comfortable room. That room though was right by the elevator and it was torture hearing the sounds of the elevator which just would never stop. I asked for late checkout at 1pm and the receptionist refused stating that we would be charged for a half day, if were not out by noon. I had to speak to the manager who gave us till 1pm. Please stay away from this hotel, I think a Holiday Inn would be better. Andrew F. Gulli

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel in the Gold Coast”
Reviews.Author: spoons99
Reviews.Content: The Talbott is a real nice boutique hotel right in the heart of the Gold Coast, one of the nicest neighborhoods in Chicago, and about 1.5 blocks from the Magnificent Mile. The lobby finishes and the staff were very friendly, and appeared to be accomidating. We didn't really need anything, but if we did, we could have asked anybody, and they would have helped us. The room well apointed, and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was nice and has a timed heater function, that can be used in the bitter Chicago winter mornings. The location of the hotel is increadible. You are two blocks from the Red Line "L" train that runs all hours of the day. You are 2 blocks from The Bloomingdales building, John Hancock Building, Water Tower, and all the shops on Michigan Avenue. You are by great restaurants, shopping, and transportation. This hotel is a good deal for the location and accomidations. I would definetly recommend this hotel; however, read the WARNING BELOW: ******WARNING******** There are 3 major constructions occuring to the west, and north of the building. Construction is at the early stages of this property, but in the coming year(s), major construction will occur, and it will be right next door to the hotel. We were on the 13th floor (lucky), but we heard very faint construction, Tuesday moring. My big suggestion, would be to get a high floor room, and by around next year at this time, be warned of major construction at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: G M
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room suite, the size was like an apartment, the bathroom was huge and the hotel has an excellent location, we have all the restaurants and shopping two blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “The Talbott was a Treat!”
Reviews.Author: MoxieMT
Reviews.Content: Great staff, quiet, and well appointed room. Walking distance from great shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Treasure in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: bmeec
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a delightful, small hotel in the heart of Chicago, The Talbott is for you. It is a perfect location and a true hideaway from the chaotic city. We had a standard room and it was very large. The bathrooms are small, but that comes with an older hotel. The beds were awesome as was the maid service. The staff was excellent...always helpful and attentive...we all loved the bellmen! The only complaint would be that the bar closes very early....sometimes before 11PM.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to turn 30!!!!”
Reviews.Author: amb2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Talbott from the 4th-7th of August and it was wonderful. We were steps from several streets that had tons to do. We also bought 3 day bus passes and just jumped on and off around town seeing and doing everything we could pack in 4 full days. Gene at the concierge desk checked us in for our flight before we got to the airport on our way out, he booked us reservations to restaurants, gave us an umbrella when it started to rain, held our bags when we checked out as we had a late flight so we wondered around town some more, and he gave us directions to this place and that place. Our room was always clean and they put my flowers in the room that arrived for my birthday from a friend. We love to travel and go to new places trying not to repeat trips as we all know so much to do and see out there, but I would go back to the Talbott and especially Chicago. Everyone was super nice and super informative. Although do not eat at the place in the hotel, way overpriced and not that wonderful, nor was our waiter or the wrestling on the TV. If you need great places to eat, Quartinos on State ask for Zach he was awesome, great for lunch as it gets really crowded at dinner, Devon we went to late and it is super nice and the food is terrific, Kitchs'n on Chicago, way down Chicago, they have soy lattes, i was sooooooooo happy, it is in the same place as Japonaise which is also wonderful and beautiful, do not go on a weekend to japonaise way too crowded. we went on a monday night and it still got really crowded but we were already there when the crowd rolled in at 7pm plus they have a beautiful bar downstairs, order all appetizers so you can try everything. Giordanos on Michigan and Superior (get there at 1045am walk to the bar and order your pizza as it takes 45 min to cook so when you sit down at 11 you can eat a salad or something then your pizza comes and you will not be waiting in line for 2 hours like everyone else, i recommened the stuffed spinach if you just like your pizza easy cheese instead of overly cheesy), if you want a specialty coffee shop the only one i found in the city is Cafe Deluca on Damen in Wiker Park everything else is a starbucks. The people were nice and it is very Austin, Texas the entire area. Hope this was helpful. Check out the free trolleys, stained glass museum (navy Pier), botanical garden and zoo (lincoln Park), millienium park, beach, etc. I LOVE CHICAGO!!! If you go in August like we did take extra shorts, i wore jeans thinking it would be lots cooler than Texas, wrong. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: LovetheRitz
Reviews.Content: My husband attended a conference in Chicago for the weekend of June 22nd and I decided to tag along for the shopping! We flew into O'Hare and took a cab to the hotel, cost about $30. Everybody from the doorman to reception desk to concierge were extremely friendly and helpful. We had a room on the 9th floor which overlooked the construction, but we were hardly in the room so it didn't bother us. We were also never awakened due to construction noise and my husband is a very light sleeper. The room was clean and spacious enough for us. The bed is very comfy. We ate in the restaurant downstairs several times for breakfast and lunch and all meals were great. The location of this hotel is perfect. You are about 1&1/2 blocks from Michigan Ave and the Hancock tower. Can't beat that! There is also an adorable pet store called Tails In The City across from the hotel! I brought our dog back a couple of toys! They are very nice as well. All in all, no complaints. The hotel is clean and beyond what we were expecting. The staff is always friendly and the location is superb. It's a safe neighborhood-I walked around by myself and felt fine. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cofjoy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from our second stay at The Talbott. It was wonderful to see the same friendly staff and they welcomed us with kind words, good service, and efficient checkin. Our room was an executive king suite (701)- roomy, great beds and bedding and an incredibly large bathroom. The bathroom had 2 sinks and large tub and separate shower. The only thing not so great were the livingroom chairs (very uncomfortable) and outdated televisions. However, we were told that new flat screens have been ordered. The maid service was efficient and rooms were very clean. I tried the complimentary pass to the fitness club which was only a 5 minute walk from hotel. I recommend it. We did not eat at the hotel nor did we try room service but I am sure it would be great as the restaurant was always busy and the food did look yummy. The concierge staff was extremely helpful and made reservations and suggestions for us, etc. We love this hotel for its location and understated elegance among all the other reasons I have mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “Classy & Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: KTBR
Reviews.Content: Mid-May my husband and I stayed at the Talbott Hotel in Chicago for 3 nights. It was awesome! The hotel's website does not reflect how beautiful and stylish it is. I have attached our pictures so you can understand. The rooms have been updated and are gorgeous, elegant, and sparkling clean. I told the front desk that they have to update their website! It does not reflect the hotel at all. We had booked a regular king room and when we arrived we found out we had been upgraded to a suite! The suite was huge! Practically the size of our apartment in DC! Again the rooms are newly refurbished. We had a beautiful bedroom with European, old world style furnishings, a living room, and the most amazing bathroom with 2 sinks, a shower, and soaking hot tub. Even though there was construction going on we never heard a thing! They have really good, thick windows. The hotel is in a really fun part of Chicago called the "Gold Coast". There are tons of cool shops and restaurants all within the blocks of the hotel. It is about a 10 minute walk to the Magnificent Mile and river. We never used it but they give you complimentary passes to a nearby gym. We had the buffet breakfast in the charming bistro. The lobby is really warm and inviting and the staff fabulous and professional. I totally recommend The Talbott Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “sweet home in chicago”
Reviews.Author: lotusmartinis
Reviews.Content: We bookended a recent trip to Illinois, Wisconsin and Michigan with two visits to Chicago, where we stayed both times at the small but elegant Talbott Hotel. I'd never heard of the hotel before, but booked it following reviews on this site. I cannot recommend it highly enough. The hotel staff are friendly and welcoming; the accommodations more than ample, boasting top quality bed linens and nicely appointed baths throughout. On our first stay we were given a complimentary upgrade to a luxurious Executive King; room 1202 was spacious and airy, with a particularly nice bath which included a lighted makeup mirror, Aveda toiletries, his and her bathrobes and separate bath and shower. On our return stay we were given a Double Queen, which too was large and pleasant, with a slightly less opulent bathroom (single shower/bath) but delightful nevertheless. There is construction going on next door, but we never heard a bit of it. Everyone on staff is cheerful and gracious, and the hotel's Bice Bistro makes both a nice place for breakfast and a lively spot for a nightcap. I don't believe we'll be staying anywhere else when we're in town ~ we've found our home away from home. And of course, they have that cow climbing up the side of the building. You don't get that at the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we could have wanted from The Talbott!!”
Reviews.Author: CMC68
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a fantastic, three night trip to Chicago and loved every minute at The Talbott! The location was fantastic - we walked to every meal and shopping location. The staff was unsurpassed! They couldn't have been more helpful. The concierge staff secured our dinner reservations and made many helpful suggestions. The hotel was well appointed with beautiful rooms and bathrooms. Everything was immaculate and very charming. We loved the little bistro tables that lined the street - great for relaxing and 'people watching" before we ventured out for dinner. We will certainly stay at the Talbott next time we visit Chicago. We wouldn't change a thing about our experience!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful personalized service at The Talbott Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DSF0
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Talbott Hotel May 14-18. The entire experience was extremely enjoyable. The hotel staff was courteous, friendly and helpful. The room was beautiful and spacious with lots of storage areas. It was very quiet, clean and comfortable. The location of the Talbott is convenient to Michigan Ave, boutiques, and restaurants. I will return to the Talbott Hotel whenever I visit Chicago and hope to find some of the same wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: micalp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed from April 27 to April 29th. It was my first trip to the city. This was a terrific location - it was close to great shopping and good restaurants. I could not have chosen better. The staff were all very helpful - all around a good choice. I would stay again. Ask for GENE at the conceirge desk - you'll be lucky if he's on - he was terrific, a real pleasure, very helpful. A few things however to be aware of - there is a lot of construction going on opposite the hotel so the room we had (very clean by the way with comfy beds) overlooked the construction site and they do work on Saturdays and Sundays. Now we weren't bothered as we head out early in the morning but something to be aware of. We booked online - make sure you check the rates regularily. I had booked at $309 per night but then checked a week or so later and the rate went down to $209 per night so I cancelled and rebooked at the lesser rate. However - still a great hotel and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: LKBehan
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the finest resorts and hotels in various locations throughout the United States both on business and pleasure trips. This hotel is absolutely the best overall property of any. The concierge staff, particularly Stephanie, are genuinely interested in being helpful in a sincere, friendly manner. They are well informed and eager to make your stay as pleasant as possible. The hotel is immaculately maintained. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The bathroom was obviously designed by a woman! There are countless little touches that make you want to go home and re-do your own bathroom! The hotel is centrally located and incredibly quiet. They even provide delicious, really fresh fruit in a bowl in the lobby! We can't wait to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: secnin
Reviews.Content: Always a delight. Have stayed several times, the latest this past weekend3/21-4/2/07 and I am always glad to return. If you are looking for a small, personal hotel where the entire staff treats you special then this is the place to stay. Our children who range from 6-16 love it even if there's no pool!!!

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break Base”
Reviews.Author: txhawki
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at this great hotel. Updated rooms. Clean. Used Tim to book theater and dinning reservations. Provided excellent service. Close to subway, shopping and dinning. Excellent value. Free wireless internet and access to nearby health club very nice perks. Highly recommend it. Future concern is adjacent construction of condos. Not a problem while we were there but something to ask front desk about in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: msu17
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights at the Talbott at the end of February. This little hotel was the perfect place for us. The lobby is very small but also cozy, and with both fireplaces going it was a welcoming atmosphere coming in from the cold. The staff was very friendly and efficient. The room was pretty spacious, and the king bed was extremely comfortable. We had a seventh floor room facing delaware st, so there was really no view. The bathroom was a good size, including two sinks and a spacious tub/shower. There was also free wireless internet...a big plus for us. Perhaps the best thing about the Talbott is the location. We were only a few steps from State, Rush, and North Michigan. Tons of shopping, bars, and good food are easily within walking distance. This makes the Talbott a great place for tourists who want to walk around and take everything in. We highly recommend the Talbott, and will gladly stay again on return trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great surprise at the Talbott”
Reviews.Author: mwadness
Reviews.Content: After hearing my second daughter from college was meeting us in Chicago, we needed a roll away in our suite we had booked at another hotel . After being told we were not allowed to have one, we started looking for another hotel and came across the Talbott on the Orbitz web site. It looked great and was in the best location, but I must say I was skeptical as to the price and the pictures shown of the room. I really doubted they would be as nice as they looked on line. What a great surprise! The suite was beautiful! It was so large that you could have a full living room and still have room for 2 roll-aways if needed. It was clean, it was newly done over. The location couldn't be better and the staff was the most courteous and bent over backwards to be helpful. I will return to the Talbott anytime I have to return to Chicago. It definitely is the best place in Chicago for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Europe in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: gfreiberg
Reviews.Content: As we pulled away in a taxi heading to the airport for our trip home my wife turned to me and said "We picked the right place." Having chosen the Talbott from other Trip Advisor reviews I found myself thinking in terms of a Trip Advisor review when we arrived. Nice entrance, friendly reception, I noticed everything and immediately knew the Talbott was a non-corporate warm hotel with touches not typically seen in big name hotel chains. The smell of the elevator and attention to decorative details strongly reminded me of Europe, simple, not overstated but elegant. The location is great, there was light snow but we walked to the Art Institute, Rush Street, the Theater District, and we're from California where anything below 50 degrees keeps us inside! All I can say is if you are the kind of traveler that wants comfort, class and somewhere unique, stay at the Talbott. Oh yeah, we were in a room that looked down at the construction, we were on the 15th floor and could not hear a sound, it was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and staff wonderful”
Reviews.Author: rlsderbycity
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our three teen age children spent a long weekend at the Talbott and had a great time. We had a room with two queen beds that was a nice size and were able to add a roll away bed without being too cramped. The conceriege was great with excellent tips on restaurants and other activities. Easy walk to shopping and also took the subway (a short walk away) to the Bears game. I felt it was reasonably priced and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Earplugs.”
Reviews.Author: queenltg
Reviews.Content: In a word - NOISY. A new hotel is being constructed out back. They start at 8 a.m. sharp and don't end until late at night. Every Day. I'd wait until it's done before staying there. If you only need one bed, they can move your room to the front of the hotel where it's not as bad. If you need more than one bed, though, you're out of luck. The hotel is nice, restaurant has very good food and otherwise the stay was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service”
Reviews.Author: HondaDoug
Reviews.Content: What a nice experience with a warm and friendly staff, comfortable and clean rooms, and great beds. Even the Aveda bath products were top shelf. Only complaint parking pricey but it is the Big City so no real surprise. Would absolutely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “An Outstanding Hotel in a Big City”
Reviews.Author: Luckyladyh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Talbott for 18 days while working at a tradeshow at McCormick Place. I was a little worried - being assigned to a smaller hotel - you just never know - you really have to trust the reviews. Boy was I thrilled. The hotel is on a tree lined street, within a half block of the Four Seasons (that tells you the neighborhood is in fact nice).
